loans.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ROSMERY, TIENE 40 AÑOS, ES CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "SANTA ROSA DE HUAQUILLAY" DESDE HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 3 AÑOS,DONDE DESEMPEÑA EL CARGO DE SECRETARIA HACE 8 MESES; Y LA APRECIAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA LLENANDO EL LIBRO DE ACTAS.
EL GRUPO SANTA ROSA DE HUAQUILLAY ESTÁ INTEGRADO POR 9 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE COMAS, DE LA ZONA DE HUAQUILLAY.
LA SRA. ROSMERY, SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE COMPOSTURA DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR, ELLA INICIÓ TRABAJANDO PARA UNA EMPRESA, DONDE APRENDIÓ LO NECESARIO PARA INDEPENDIZARSE, AHORA ELLA ATIENDE EN SU CASA Y CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO MEJORAR SUS MÁQUINAS DE TRABAJO Y A LA VEZ HACER UNOS ARREGLOS Y MEJORAS EN SU CASA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO ES PARA INVERTIR EN MATERIALES DE COSTURA,PARA TENER UN STOCK DE MERCADERÍA QUE OFRECER AL PÚBLICO, YA QUE ESTÁ EN PROCESO DE CRECIMIENTO.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 40 years old. She is married and she has 3 small children. She has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Huaquillay" group for approximately 3 years and she has been the secretary for 8 months. She can be seen in the photo writing in the minutes book. The Santa Rosa de Huaquillay is made up of 9 people who are residents of the district of Comas, in the Huaquillay zone. Rosmery sews clothing. She started out by working at a company where she learned enough to become independent. Now she works from her home. With her work she has been able to improve her sewing machines and also make some repairs and improvements in her house. The requested loan is buy materials for sewing, so that she can have a stock of merchandise to offer to the public, since she is already gaining more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The loan will go towards purchasing large quantities of fishing products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy beef  (ground, back, rib and bone) and pork.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia T. is 35 and married with 5 children (ages 4 - 15).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sesilia has 3 years of experience in this business.  Sesilia needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Sesilia joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sesilia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sesilia T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en:
Nusura S. is currently in the business of selling bread and cooked beef in a restaurant, She is requesting a loan to buy stock of rice, beans, bags of maize flour, etc. to be cooked in the restaurant. Nusura is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice, beans, maize flour, etc. to be cooked in the restaurant

loans.name: Nirosha

texts.en:
Nirosha is a 40-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Yakabadda, Sri Lanka. They have five children, aged from 15 to 27.

Nirosha's husband manages an electrical goods shop which she used to help with, and recently she has started a rental store providing equipment to rent to local customers. They both have gained a lot of experience in running these businesses and consider themselves very hard workers. Nirosha uses the earnings from her business to help manage daily family expenses.

Nirosha is asking for a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help increase the goods in her rental shop.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her rental store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario es cliente antiguo, trabajó con Emprender desde el año 2007,siempre trabajo con crédito individual, el se dedica al trabajo de cerrajeria, haciendo puertas, ventanas, rejas y todo tipo de trabajos, como arreglos de cocinas, hornos etc, es una persona muy dinámica, ya que se traslada de un lado a otro en busca de trabajos, él tiene un hijo que estudia y trabaja a la vez, la esposa es trabajadora del hogar en la zona de Achumani, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona de Coqueni, que se encuentra al frente de la oficina de Emprender en  Chasquipampa, cruzando el rio, el crédito que ahora solicitó lo invertira en compra de fierro, electrodos y pintura para realizar un trabajo de puerta de garaje y de rejas según lo que comentó, el saca montos pequeños de acuerdo a su posibilidad de pago, en esta ocasión la esposa le colaborara en los pagos, ambas personas son responsables y comprometidas con la Institución. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mario is a long-standing Emprender client; he’s been collaborating with us since 2007, always with individual loans. He is a locksmith but makes lots of iron items like: doors, windows, grilles and all kinds of other jobs like stoves, ovens, etc. He is a very dynamic person who goes from place to place seeking work. He has a son that both works and goes to school. His wife is employed as a domestic in Achumani. They live in their own home in Coqueni, which is across from the Chasquipampa Emprender office, on the other side of the river. He commented that he will use the present loan to buy iron, electrodes and paint to do a job consisting of making a garage door and window grilles. He takes out small amounts according to his ability to pay; on this occasion, his wife will help with the repayments and both of them are responsible and committed to the Institution. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron for his shop.

loans.name: Botoyarova Halis`s Group

texts.ru:
Халис 40 лет. Ее супруг автомастер, в месяц зарабатывает около 120 долларов. У нее 4 детей. Дочерям (25, 23) лет , сыновьям (20,16) лет. Бизнес клиентки семейный. В основном занимается сын, закупает корм для живности и  откармливает их. Сама клиента также работает техничкой в школе. Она планирует закупить теленка для откорма и реализации.

Мукадасхон 37 лет. У нее 4 детей: дочери 13, сыновьям (10,8,2) лет. Все дети школьники. Клиент активно занимается реализацией молочной продукции, также делает наемные работы. Бизнес был начат 4 года назад на накопленные пособия детей и на сбережения закупили овца, откормив реализовали и закупили корову. Сейчас они планируют закупить овца для откорма и перепродажи.

Мухайехон, 39, замужем. Ее супруг строитель. Клиент занимается наемной работой. В день зарабатывает около 4 долларов, кроме этого выращивают живность. Она планирует закупить овец для откорма и реализации.

Гулчехре 38 лет. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. У нее трое детей. Все они школьники. клиент занимается полеводством, сеет картофель для реализации и готовит землю для посева хлопка. Планирует закупить семена хлопчатника и минеральные удобрения.

Мукаддамхон занимается сельским хозяйством, как и другие участники этой группы. Сейчас она возделывает землю, чтобы посеять хлопок. Кредит нужен для закупа ГСМ.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Halis, 40, is married. Her husband is an auto mechanic making about $120 a month. Halis has 4 children: two daughters (25 and 23) and two sons (20 and 16). The family's business, a cattle farm, is run mainly by Halis's son. Halis works as a cleaning lady at a local school. This loan Halis will use to purchase a calf for the family farm. Mukadashon, 37, is a mother of four: a thirteen years old daughter and three sons (10, 8, and 2). Mukadashon sells dairy products and works as a wage worker. Mukadashon started her business 4 years ago with the money from her savings and her children's public assistance. Then, she purchased a sheep, which Mukadashon later resold at a profit and purchased a cow. This loan Mukadashon will use to purchase a sheep to resell it with a profit later. Muhayyohon, 39, is married. Her husband is a builder. Muhayyohon makes about $4 a day as a wage worker. In addition to that, Muhayyohon raises cattle. She will use this loan to purchase sheep. Gulchehra is 38. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Gulchehra has 3 children--all of them of school age. Gulchehra has been growing potatoes and plans to grow cotton. She will use this loan to purchase cotton seeds and mineral fertilizer. Mukaddamhon, just like the other members of this group of borrowers, is a farmer. She now prepares her land to grow cotton. She needs this loan to purchase fuel.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf, sheep, cotton seeds and fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Edy Juan

texts.es:
Edy A. de 37 años vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso (llamado así por sus abundantes lomas y montañas sus calles son de tierra y la mayoría de casas son de caña) de Guayaquil. Su esposa es ama de casa pero a sus conocidos les vende cosméticos, ellos tienen tres hijos de 13, 11, 4 años de edad. 

El papa de Edy tenia un taller electrónico donde hacia arreglos de televisores, radios y otros aparatos eléctricos, a Edy desde pequeño empezó a interesarle lo que el papa hacia, cuando el llegaba de la escuela y después de terminar sus deberes el se quedaba en el taller aprendiendo todo lo que el papa hacia mientras que los otros niños estaban jugando. Fue cuando se caso que construyo su casa y la parte delantera la readecuo de madera y caña para poner hay su taller electrónico. 

Por esa buena decisión ahora el tiene un taller de electrónica, trabaja desde las 08h00 am hasta las 18h00 pm todos los días. Su hijo de 13 años también le ayuda en el taller cuando llega de clases. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cables integrados y filtros para utilizarlos en su negocio. 

En el futuro el quiere comprar un carro para transportar los televisores, radios y artículos electrónicos que arregla.
texts.en:
Edy A. is 37 years old and lives in a semi-urban area in Paraiso (Paradise--called that due to its many hills and mountains and the dirt street and homes made of reeds) de Guayaquil. His wife is a homemaker who also sells cosmetics to her neighbors; they have 3 children who are 4, 11, and 13 years old. Edy's father had an electronics workshop where he fixed TVs, radios, and other electric appliances. At a young age, Edy became interested in what his father was doing and when he'd get home from school, he would finish his chores then stay in the workshop to learn everything his father knew while other kids would be playing. When he got married, he built his house and made the front portion into his own electronics workshop. Due to this good decision, he now has his own electronics workshop where he works from 8 am to 6 pm every day. His son is 13 years old and helps him with the work when he gets home from school. He will use the loan to buy cables and filters to use in his business. In the future, he'd like to buy a car to transport the TVs, radios and other appliances that he fixes.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Filters and integral cables

loans.name: Mazbut

texts.en:
R. Mazbut is 36 years old and married with 4 children. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years; farming is his passion. He practices both dairy farming and mixed crop farming. Mazbut says he has chosen farming as a career because his farm produce has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing all his land because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees and was not able to buy enough seeds and fertilizers. Mazbut is requesting a loan of $2500 USD to be able to plough the whole farm for the next planting season and to buy fertilizer and seeds.   
   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:  Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Mrs. Horm L. was born into a farming family during the civil war and became a farmer, raising crops and pigs, when she was grown up. She is now married and blessed with three kids who attend school. Her husband assists her on the farm.

The coming rainfall season is a great time for cultivating a rice crop, but Horm L. doesn’t have any supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seed to grow

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza B. is from the village of  Valencia Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Liza is married and has 1 school-aged child. Liza owns & operates a food business, making and selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila lives in a three-room brick house in a city named Borewala, in Pakistan, with her husband, I. M., and her four children.  She has three daughters and one son. She is a kind and patient housewife. All day her children of different ages have different needs, so she has to take care of them and her house.

Her husband works in a factory earning a monthly wage, and her eldest daughter has been working for a year in a beauty salon. Jamila has applied for a loan for her daughter for the second time. With the loan her daughter will buy the beauty products and make-up supplies needed for starting her own beauty salon. Then she will be able to earn more and utilize her work experience in a better way.
 
Jamila has a good credit record with no delays in repayment. She is confident that this time also she will maintain her good credit behavior.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and make-up supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith C. is from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Judith is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Judith is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame FATOU D. est une femme de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 19 novembre 2004.

Elle fait un petit commerce de friperies, de chaussures et de parfums. Elle pratique cette activité depuis bientôt trois ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des friperie pour 250.000 francs CFA, des chaussures pour 130.000 francs CFA et des parfums pour 100.000 francs CFA. Elle paye des frais de transport à raison de 20.000 franc CFA.

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou D. is a 39-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children. She also supports two other children who are entrusted to her by friends or relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of WALIDANE since November 19, 2004. She has a small business involving used clothing, shoes, and perfumes. She has had this business for nearly three years. With her new loan, Fatou is going to buy second-hand clothing for 250,000 francs CFA, some shoes for 130,000 francs, and perfumes 100,000 francs. She is covering the cost of transport at 20,000 francs. Her goal is to help support her family financially while increasing her savings at the same time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing, shoes, and some perfrumes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, a girl and a boy who are both in school. Her husband is a mechanic. She operates a small hotel and would like to buy wheat flour, maize flour and beans with the Ksh. 40,000 loan. 

She hopes to provide her children with a good education as she cites food and school fees as her greatest expenses. She decided to join Yehu because she believed that it is a good microfinance institution that can help women who are low-income earners. She hopes to expand her hotel so she can accommodate more customers. Miriam rents her home with electricity and no water.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Isheka

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Isheka, a married father of three children aged 4, 6 and 13 years respectively. He has one additional dependent living with him that he is helping to educate. A very hard working man, in 2005 Isheka established his used clothing business, an enterprise he is determined to keep profitable. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le800000 every month from this business.

Isheka is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000SLL. in order to buy more stock, hoping to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000SLL. In the future, Isheka plans to expand his business, build a house for his family, and continue to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Sotha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotha V., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sophaneth Mao, 43, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers from the city. They have been married for 15 years and have six children: five sons and one daughter. Four of them attend school and the other two are still young.  

Sotha has been working for a non-profit for seven years, while her husband has been a driver for 10 years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet S. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, who are both currently in school. Annet has a business of selling second hand clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Annet hopes to own a house. Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to work hard.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina O. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Divina is married and has four children. Her children's ages are 23, 22, 14, and 5. To make a living, Divina grows crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various products. Divina works hard to feed her family and provide for her family's needs.

Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She said she is happy about the microinsurance program it offers. Divina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Madinah has a business of stone quarrying, which she has had for 4 years. She does poultry  

To help expand her business, Madinah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase stone materials. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Madinah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Madinah hopes to become a teacher. Madinah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: stone materials

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara N. lives in the Kawempe Bishop Mukwaya zone neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives). Hajara has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Hajara sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Hajara has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more batches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and motorcycle for hire. The main business challenge(s) for Hajara include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and educate her children up to university. Hajara lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He has over eight years of experience working with a pick-up. He works on a freelance basis, offering delivery service upon the request of his clients. He delivers furniture, used items, etc. His business income is vital to pay for his two children's schooling and to meet their needs. He is the main income provider for the family; his wife is a housewife. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to perform maintenance needed on the van, which is in bad condition, especially before the coming winter season. He hopes that with the help of this loan, he will do his work properly and earn a good income for his relatives.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Rakiatou

texts.fr: RAkiatou a 45 ans et  est mariée à médecin. Elle est mère de 3 enfants.   Elle  fait le commerce de pagnes et bijoux et compte  13 ans dans cette activité.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite à côté du marché Agoé. Elle    sollicite un prêt  pour acquérir 10 pièces de pagnes BT,  10 pièces de pagnes  Bazins et 10 pièces de pagnes phoenis et 20 paquets de chaines.
texts.en: Rakiatou is 45.  She is married to a doctor, and has three children.  For 13 years, she has been selling traditional cloth and jewelry.  She buys her stock in the big marketplace in Lomé et sells it in the Agoé marketplace.  She is asking for a loan to buy 30 lengths of wax cloth (10 BT brand, 10 Bazin brand and 10 Phoenix brand) and 20 packs of jewelry chains.

loans.use: Buy cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en: Sixteen members of this group have applied for a loan. All live in Sambuor village in Kandal province. Mrs. Than L., who is 35 years old and married to a police officer, has been chosen as group leader by the members, each of whom will use a portion of this loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Than L. earns her living by providing beautician services for weddings, and will use her portion of this loan to buy the clothing and supplies she needs to serve her customers. She and her husband plan to use the additional income made possible by this loan to support their three children, all of whom are in school.

loans.use: To buy clothes and supplies needed to run a small business.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Uma P.. She is married and has three children, aged 20, 17 and 14. In 2006, she established her tea shop business. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Uma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Las Rayadas Group

texts.es:
Las Rayadas, es un grupo de Credituyo, que puso su nombre debido a que todas son aficionadas al equipo de futbol soccer Rayados de Monterrey. El grupo solidario esta conformado de 6 mujeres, y este es ya su segundo prestamo con la institucion. Una de las señoras del grupo es Rosa Maria P. de 59 años, ella es divorciada y para su sustento cuenta con un puesto de comidas que establece en diferentes mercados dependiendo el dia. En su puesto ella vende comida mexicana variada como mole, arroz, tacos, tamales, burritos y muchos otros platillos. Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio por 8 anos y le gusta mucho estar en mercados ya que cada dia son diferentes los clientes y asi puede llegar a mucha gente. 
La Sra Rosa tiene 6 hijos que ya no dependen de ella por ser mayores de edad y tiene ya muchos nietos. Dos de sus hijos, Cristian Tadeo y Dulce, la ayudan con su negocio, a llevar la mercancia, poner el puesto, y a vender. Ella quiere utilizar este prestamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar una nueva estructura para su puesto y mas lona, esto le permitira que su puesto sea mas estable y mas grande para poder atender a mas clientes. Ella dice que los platillos favoritos de sus clientes son los chiles rellenos, el pollo frito, el arroz y el mole. Su sueño es algun dia poder juntar los ahorros suficientes para tener un restaurante fijo donde pueda vender el mismo tipo de comidas.
texts.en:
“Las Rayadas”, one of the groups with Credituyo, got its name because all of its members are fans of the soccer team “Rayados de Monterrey”. This solidarity group consists of six women and they are already participating in their second loan cycle with Credituyo.

One of the women in the group is Rosa Maria P.. She is 59 years old, divorced, and makes her living by working at a food stand that she sets up at different markets depending on the day of the week. Rosa sells different types of Mexican food from her stand such as mole, rice, tacos, tamales, burritos, and many other dishes. She has been in this business for eight years and enjoys going to the markets each day where different customers and crowds of people arrive. Sra. Rosa has six adult children who are not dependent on her and many grandchildren. Two of her children, Cristian Tadeo and Dulce, help her with her business by bringing goods to her stand and selling the food. Rosa wants to use this loan to expand her business and purchase a new stand and more canvas. A structure that is larger and more stable will enable her to serve more customers. She says that her customers’ favorite dishes are stuffed peppers, fried chicken, rice, and mole. Her dream is to someday have enough savings to have an established restaurant where she can sell all types of food.

loans.use: Acquire a new food stand

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. PovS. was born in 1970, and she lives in Lvea Sa Kraom village in Kandal province. She earns her living by selling fruit in the market. She owns only a bicycle for transporting her fruit to the market. In order to support her business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting her fruit. She will add some of her own savings to the loan in order to purchase the motorcycle. 
 
Mrs. PovS. is a widow with three children: one works at a business washing cars, one is a laborer, and one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Pedro Emmanuel

texts.es: El Joven Pedro Emmanuel I., es el hijo mayor de la Sra.  María Concepción S. y viven juntos en el domicilio que con esfuerzos adquirió el joven Pedro, y como los dos están trabajando ellos han decidido protegerse de la inseguridad ampliando la barda que cerrara el frente de su domicilio, ya que la casa se queda sola durante el día, se van a trabajar sin dejar de pensar que alguien pudiera meterse a su domicilio es por esta razón que ellos piensan que al terminar de construir la barda, quedara mas seguro su  domicilio agradecen a esta institución el haber otorgado el crédito que los ayudara y apoyara a llevar a cabo su tan anhelado proyecto.
texts.en:
Pedro Emmanuel I. is Mrs. María Concepción S.’s oldest son.  They live together in a house Pedro acquired through much effort.  Since they both are employed they want to increase security expanding the wall that will close off the front of their house because the house is unattended all day; they go to work always concerned that someone could break into their house and this is why they want to finish building the wall.  Their house will be more secure.

They are grateful to the institution for having granted the loan that will help them and support their effort to carry out their much wanted project.

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio, age 48, is a rice farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. He sells his harvested rice to members of his community. He and his wife have five children. Florencio works hard to improve his business and his family's living conditions. He is currently making improvements to their house. He also hopes to be able to sustain his children's education. 

Florencio's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and farm equipment, such as a new plow. He hopes to earn a better income from his next harvest so that he can complete the family house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm equipment, such as a new plow

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon M. presently resides in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh city. He makes an income by working in the garment industry as a sewing-machine repairer and earns a formal salary monthly. His wife also works as a sewing worker in the garment factory. The couple usually generates a daily profit of around $5 each day to use for the family. 

Chhuon M. would like to request a loan to build a new kitchen for his whole family to use to cook tasty meals. Chhuon M. is blessed with two children who still study in the public school.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen for his family

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 36 years old and is still single. He lives in Banga, South Cotabato. 

Jessie has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. He plans to use his loan to purchase feed and vitamins. He will also buy materials to expand his piggery. Each month, Jessie earns 3,000 PHP from raising hogs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and materials for piggery expansion

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino es una padre de familia de 55 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólode luz, ubicada en lazona rural del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estos lugares desarrollan la actividad agícola, ganadera y turismo.

Paulino es agricultor desde hace 10 años, cuenta con varias hectáreas de terreno en los cuales cultiva limón y mango, estos productos que cultiva son muy rentables, en especial el limón ya que no necesita mucho tiempo para cosechar, mientras que el mango sólo se cosecha en época de verano (desde diciembre a febrero), pero gracias a los ingresos que obtiene  puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y familia.

Por eso Paulino ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra a las personas que le ayudan a cuidar sus tierras de cultivo y así pueda seguir creciendo su negocio e incrmentando sus ganacias.

Paulinoes un hombre responsable y muy considerado con las personas que trabajan con él, ya que gracias a su labor, todos pueden llevar un poco de dinero a casa para sus gastos disrios.
texts.en:
Paulino is the father of a family. He is 55 years old and he lives with his wife and children. They have a house of their own and it is only equipped with hydro. It is located in the rural region of the district of Tambogrande, at about 40 minutes from the department of Piura. The primary businesses for each of these regions is agriculture, farming, and tourism.

Paulino has been an agriculturist for the past 10 years. He has several hectares of land where he cultivates lemons and mangoes. The products that he cultivates are very profitable, especially lemons because it doesn't take much time to yield a harvest. Mangoes, on the other hand, yield only one harvest during the summer season (from December to February). But thanks to these sources of income he is able to provide for the household expenses and those of his family.

For this reason Paulino has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the among of 1500 neuvos soles through Capital Semilla. He will purchase fertilizers and he will hire farm hands to help him maintain his cultivation fields. This will help him keep expanding his business and to increase his earnings.

Paulino is a responsible man who is very considerate of individuals who work with him. It is thanks to their labor that they are able to take home a little bit of money for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to hire help.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel tiene 57 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de relojería. Hace más de 34 años que tiene este negocio, ha logrado sacarlo delante por medio de financiamientos y se siente muy agradecido. La falta de oportunidades laborales lo motivaron a hacerse de su propio negocio. Agradece la oportunidad que le da la vida de sacar adelante a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos para los que visualiza un mejor futuro. José sueña con agrandar su negocio cada día más y que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y para empezar a hacerlo realidad necesita de un préstamo que le permita comprar repuestos, fajas, pin, pinzas entre otros.
texts.en:
José Daniel, 57, has been repairing watches for over 34 years.  Loans have helped him stay in business and he is very grateful.  

Lack of employment opportunities motivated him to open a business of his own.  He is grateful for the opportunity life gives him to move his wife and four children ahead.  He envisions a better future for them.

José dreams with enlarging his business more each day so that he will be able to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  To start doing so, he needs a loan that will make it possible for him to buy replacement parts: bands, pins and pliers, among others.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Wilmer Reinaldo

texts.es:
Wilmer Reinaldo tiene 22 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Wilmer Reinaldo is 22 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children. He resides in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Señor de La Salud” (Lord of Health) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Soloma, which is part of the canton of Echeandia. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Wilmer is a farmer who grows corn and rice. His purchases are made in Ventanas and he sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially acquire the supplies he needs. Among the challenges he faces are pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to buy a car.

Wilmer enjoys walking through the fields.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Sukla

texts.en: Sukla, 37 years old, is a grocery seller; her income is $3.50 per day. She is married to a farmer who can earn only $0.70 per day. They have three children who are aged 19, 6, and 3. One of her daughters is working in a factory earning $3 daily income. Every month, Sukla has to spend $25 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $35 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her career. If she has a motorbike, it would be easy for her to travel to buy things in the market for her grocery shop.  With the profit from her career, she wants to enlarge her shop and send the rest of her children to study so they can at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her career

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina  nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente, Evangelina vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su único hijo. Evangelina venta de ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, camisas, chompas. En esta oportunidad Evangelina requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa como por ejemplo casacas, pantalones y  muchas cosas más.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Evangelina was born in the city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 50 years old. Evangelina currently lives in the city of Cusco with her only son. She sells clothing such as trousers, shirts, and sweaters. At the moment, she needs a loan to buy more clothing such as jackets, trousers, and other items.

She is a responsible and hardworking person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Mosoc Killa” which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase jackets, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, viven por el cantón  Sigsig, este cantón  es muy visitado por la belleza de sus paisajes y por su naturaleza, la mayoría de su gente se dedica a fabricar sombreros de paja toquilla, también trabajan en la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y con una gran hospitalidad.
 
La Señora María tiene 50 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 18 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, sus dos últimas hijas estudian en un colegio del lugar. Su esposo labora en la agricultura y en el área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María se dedica desde muy joven a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en el cantón de Gualaceo. También se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla ya que esta actividad aprendió desde muy joven y en su casa también vende todo tipo de ropa.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un almacén para vender la ropa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Toquilleras Communal Bank.  The members live in the Sigsig canton.  This canton is frequently visited for it beautiful scenery and its landscape.  Most of its inhabitants make panama hats.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  They are very amiable people who are very hospitable.

María, age, 59 is married and has three children.  They children are 26, 18, and 14 years old.  Her first daughter is married and independent.  The last two daughters go to high school in the area.  Her husband works in agriculture and as a bricklayer in construction.  Through their joint efforts they have managed to build their own house.

María has raised chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs since she was a young girl.  She sells them in the Gualaceo canton.  She also makes panama hats, which she learned how to do when she was very young.  She also sells all types of clothes.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes in order to stock her business.

Her goal is to have a store to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Evenor Del Carmen

texts.es: Evenor se dedica a la venta de plantas telefónicas. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. El es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad económica. Esta no es la primera experiencia que obtiene con financiamientos pues tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de fundación. El crédito es para la compra de una gran cantidad de plantas telefónicas para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evenor has been selling office phone equipment (PBX devices) for more than seven years. He is a responsible person who enjoys his business. This is not the first time he has obtained a loan since he has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time.

This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of office phone equipment so that he can meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of office phone equipment.

loans.name: Hipolito Aristides

texts.es:
Hipolito es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Hipolito es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra arroz, es un producto que se consume diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus tierras de cultivo y pago de mano de obra en la cosecha y con las ventas mejorará su calidad de vida.  Hipolito es una persona que se preocupa por que su cosecha sea la mejor para brindarle algunas comodidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hipolito is a 62-year-old family father who lives with his children in his own house. The house is not connected to public utilities and is located in the rural area of the district of Pomahuaca in the department of Cajamarca. The area is known for farming and cattle rearing.

Hipolito is a farmer. He has his own farmland where he grows rice, a product that is consumed daily. Once the rice is harvested, he sells it at the various markets in his area and thus can spend his income on family expenditures.

Hipolito came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1000 new soles through the loan program "Capital Semilla" (seed capital) to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his farmland and pay for harvesting labor. The sales will enable him to enjoy a higher quality of life. Hipolito cares for his rice crop and wants it to be as good as possible so that he can offer some comforts to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his farmland and pay for harvesting labor.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. 

Emiliano has a shop that sells herbal medicines in syrup from Blue Miracle. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines. 

Emiliano is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emiliano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: John, de 23 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía de su papá Dionisio, su mamá Telma y su 2 menores hermanos, a los que apoya económicamente en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Muruhuay. Desde muy niño ayudó a sus padres en la limpieza de la maleza que crecía constantemente en sus cultivos. Desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario con el oficio de su familia. Hace algún tiempo comenzó a sembrar en su propio terreno agrícola. Donde esparce semillas de alverja, habas, papa y hortalizas. Los cuales intercala de acuerdo a la temporada de sembrío. Vendiendo sus cosechas a unos intermediarios mayoristas del caserío de Yanama. Asimismo le falta muy poco para terminar sus estudios de mantenimiento de maquinarias, donde invierte dinero mensualmente. Culminando sus estudios piensa dedicarse a ambas actividades. Ya dio el primer paso, pues está trabajando manejando camiones de carga de productos alimenticios de la ciudad de Satipo a Lima. Ahora espera comprar más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayores cantidades con la ayuda de su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. John de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en su siembra de alverja en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
23-year-old Jhon is a hard-working young man.  He lives together with his dad Dionisio, his mom Telma, and his two younger siblings, who he supports financially, in their own home which is located in the small village of Bellavista Muruhuay.  Since he was very young, Jhon helped his parents in getting rid of the weeds that grew constantly amongst their crops.  He learned everything he needed to know about the farming business from his family.

Some time ago, Jhon started growing crops on his own plot of farmland.  He sows pea, bean, potato and vegetable seeds.  He alternates them in accordance with the sowing season.  Jhon sells his harvests to wholesale middlemen in the village of Yanama.  In addition, he has only a small amount of time left before he finishes his studies in the field of machinery maintenance.  He invests money in this each month.  When he finishes his studies, Jhon plans to work in both businesses.  He has already taken the first step as he is currently working managing trucks loaded with food products which travel between the town of Satipo and the city of Lima.  Jhon hopes to buy more farmland so that he can grow crops in larger quantities to help his family.

Jhon is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" community bank and this is his third loan from MFP.  He is grateful for the support that he receives and he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  With your support, Jhon will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over his pea crops in large amounts.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Orelyn

texts.en:
Orelyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Orelyn has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Orelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Orelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo que lo necesita para invertir en la compra de harina, Azucar y otros ingredientes, y poder mejorar la produccion de pan y repartirlo a más tiendas y mercados, ya que hay mucha demanda de clientes. El anterior prestamo le fue muy util, compro los mismos materiales ya que en la panaderia se utilizan a diario para la produccion de pan.
El objetivo de  Ana mejorar en sus ingresos, siempre tener el negocio estable y que su familia esté mejor económicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan which she needs to invest in the purchase of flour, sugar and other ingredients. She also wants to improve bread production and distribute it to more shops and markets as there is a lot of  demand from customers. The previous loan was very helpful; she bought the same ingredients as in a bakery these are used on a daily basis in the production of bread.

Ana's goal is to improve her income, always keep the business stable and that that her family be better off financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CAYO , es una persona de 32 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica del cliente y su esposa es netamente la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva y comercializa son la papa y haba en estado verde; la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza aproximadamente en una superficie cultivable de 2.5 Has. en sus propias parcelas heredadas de sus padres que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Huaylla Pujru del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante a unos 74 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El señor Cayo y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Sr. Cayo, 32, and his wife have three children.  He has a primary school education.  He's a farmer and his main crops are potatoes and green beans.  The farm covers a cultivable area of 2.5 hectares (or a little more than 6 acres).  He inherited the farm from his parents.  The farm is in Huaylla Pujru, a rural community in Tiraque, some 74 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  Sr. Cayo and his wife are hard-working and responsible people who want to improve their standard of living.  To do so, they plan to increase their output, a plan for which they need investment capital to buy chicken manure (for fertilizing the land) and seeds for their next potato crop. The investment will allow Sr. Cayo to improve the quality of life of all those who depend on him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María es cliente de hace mucho  años, ella en principio se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de una empresa muy conocida, pero hace dos años atrás esa actividad la realiza en menor escala, siendo ahora su actividad principal la repostería, ella prepara para la venta pan, queques  de plátano , naranja y pies de manzana o limón, comercializando por la zona y algunas pastelerías de la zona sur,  también realiza tortas a pedido para cumpleaños, ella es una persona joven al igual que su esposo, tienen dos hijos pequeños a los que cuida mientras trabaja preparando sus masitas, el esposo trabaja con movilidad en el un taxi trufis de la zona sur, con el dinero de crédito comprar un horno industrial y así mejorar su elaboración de tortas, el deseo de la Sra. María es el de tener su propia pastelería, ya que la señora demuestra muchas ganas de superarse, es muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: María has been a client for many years. At first she worked selling cosmetics by catalog from a well-known company, but for two years has been doing that business on a smaller scale. Now her bakery is her main business. She makes and sells bread, banana and orange cakes and lemon and apple pies. She sells them in her area and also to several pastry shops further south. She also makes birthday cakes to order. María and her husband are both young. They have two small children and she takes care of them while she works making her pastries. Her husband works in transportation and drives a taxi in the south. With the money from this loan María will buy an industrial oven and thus increase her cake production. María's dream is to have her own pastry shop. She shows a strong desire to get ahead and is very hard-working. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial oven.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha and his wife, Samoeun (pictured together), live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have three sons and one daughter. 

Chantha and his wife sell mangoes. In addition, he also drives a motor taxi. He is applying for another loan of $1,000 to purchase mango under contract for sale.

loans.use: To purchase mango under contract for sale.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a hardworking business woman aged 37. She is married and blessed with three children,two of whom are still in school. For the last 5 years, she has been selling sausages to support her family. She describes her business as busy. She has employed one person to assist her in managing the business.  With a 20,000 Kenya shillings loan, she intends to buy sausages for resale.

loans.use: To buy sausages for resale.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua  is a fish monger at Watreso. She is married to a farmer with seven dependents.  She has been a fish monger for the past seven years now. Ahosua assists her husband in the up keep of their children. She will use her loan to purchase more fish. Akosua will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: purchase more fish.

loans.name: Ndumbu Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ndumbu SHG Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Ndumbu SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Irene will save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Ndumbu SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 49 years old, and married to Leah. They have three children.

He has been in the carpentry business for 20 years from which he earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES. He is applying for his sixth loan of Kenya Shillings 10,000 KES.He paid his previous loan well and in good time.He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more carpentry machines, workshop equipments and provide for the family basic needs.

loans.use: To buy machines and workshop equipments for carpentry work.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and has six children ranging in age from twenty-three to thirty-five years. She describes herself as a decisive woman. She has been selling maize for the last twenty-four years. Her business is in a strategic location. Lucy faces the challenge of insufficient funds. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase more bags of maize. In the future, Lucy hopes to expand her business and buy a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Mulay De Curiquinga (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay de Curiquinga está formado por 10 mujeres, luchadoras, trabajadoras que buscan la manera de salir  adelante con su trabajo, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar en adelante a sus familias. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza en donde se puede disfrutar de momentos de paz fuera del ruido de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo, mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Patricia, tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad, su esposo labora en la construcción trabajando como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Patricia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos ya que aun son pequeños, también labora en la agricultura y lava ropa ajena cuando le llaman para que realice estas actividades.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maluay de Curiquinga is made up of 10 hard-working women looking for a way to get ahead in their jobs.  They work in different activities, the same ones that allow them to contribute to their household finances and provide for their families.  The live on the outskirts of the Valle en Cuenca parish.  This parish is known for its natural beauty where one can enjoy peaceful moments away from the noise of the city.  The people work as merchants, raise animals, work in agriculture and many work in different lines of work in the city.  They maintain the traditions and culture of their people.  

One of the members of this group is Señora Particia.  She is 40 years old, lives in a common law marriage and has 2 children, ages 3 and 2.  Her husband works in construction as a mason.  They don't own their own house, so they rent.  Doña Patricia is dedicated to the household chores and to caring for the children as they are still young.  She also works in agriculture and washes clothes for others when they call her.  

This is her third loan with her communal bank and she will use it to buy groceries for her household.  

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: purchase groceries.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Martha has operated a food stall for the past year; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of customers not making their payments on time. She dreams of establishing a café.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, beans, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, beans, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Madam Antoinette F. has had for two (2) years a small trade of cold water, ice, and fruit juice production in Lomé. This activity has taken an important place due to the high demand which exists in the area and especially during the dry seasons where the warmth is excessive and where members of the population are consuming to refresh themselves. Born on January 17th, 1967 and mother of three (3) children, Madam Antoinette is an accountant by trade. Unfortunately, she didn’t have the luck of a stable job. Therefore, she decided to launch in this trade which provides an income that allows her to cover her needs. Considering the importance that constitutes this activity characterised by increasingly higher demand, Madam Antoinette forecasts to expand her project by selling other products like frozen fish. The proximity of her trade near the market of N’kafu proves a great advantage. The credit of $650 that she is soliciting today will serve to buy one freezer, two coolers, supplies of fresh fish and chicken, and fruit juice fabrication products.

Madame Antoinette F. tient depuis deux ans à Lomé un petit commerce de production et de commercialisation de la glace, d’eau fraîche et de jus de fuit. Cette activité a pris une ampleur importante à cause de la forte demande qui existe dans le quartier particulièrement pendant les saisons sèches où la chaleur est excessive et où les populations en consomment assez pour se rafraîchir. Née le 17 janvier 1967 et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame Antoinette est comptable de formation, mais elle n’a pas eu la chance d’avoir un emploi stable. Aussi, a-t-elle décidé de se lancer dans ce commerce qui lui procure un revenu qui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Compte tenu de l’engouement que suscite cette activité caractérisée par une demande de plus en plus forte, Antoinette prévoit étendre son projet par la vente d’autres produits comme les poissons congelés. La proximité de son commerce à côté du marché de N’kafu lui est un très grand avantage pour l’écoulement rapide de ses produits. Le crédit de $ 850 qu’elle sollicite aujourd’hui va servir acquérir un congélateur, deux glacières et s’approvisionner régulièrement en poisson, en poulet et en produits de fabrication du jus de fruit.

loans.use: To buy one freezer and two coolers

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.en:
Adjoavi A. was born in Agoè (Golfe prefecture) in 1960. She grows crops and lives off the earth. She is married and the mother of five who manages to help with family expenses with the produce from her fields. This produce is a major source of income. Through her energy and mastery of farming, she has been able to repay her loans on time.

She is currently requesting a new loan of $750 to expand the area for cultivation and thus to increase her production of corn and cassava. This is how she hopes to have sufficient income to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1960 à Agoè (P/Golfe), Madame A. Adjoavi est une femme cultivatrice qui vit de la terre. Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle arrive à partager les dépenses de son foyer grâce aux produits de son champ qui lui procurent d’importants revenus. Par le dynamisme et la maîtrise de ses activités champêtres, elle a su rembourser ses crédits au moment convenu. A présent elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir sa superficie cultivée et par conséquent augmenter sa production de maïs et du manioc. Ainsi, compte t-elle avoir de moyens suffisants pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Growing corn and cassava

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has had her business for one and a half years. “My business is the sale of second-hand items. I have all sorts of accessories for the home and I would like to buy more inventory so that my sales can increase. I am requesting $1,000.00 to invest in merchandise for my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lourdes tiene 1 año y medio con su negocio. “Mi negocio es de venta de segunda tengo accesorios de todo tipo para el hogar y me gustaría comprar más cosas para que mis ventas aumenten”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in my business.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en: Rachelle O. is a dynamic 32-year-old  woman. She has 2 children and lives with her family in Adjamé, a commercial township in the north of Abidjan. Rachelle has been a cosmetic products seller since she was 16. She benefited from her first loan from AE&I in October 2004 and has been a good performer since then. Her business is well managed and she wants to purchase fashion products to improve her margin and revenues. Rachelle is an ambitious and well organized woman.

loans.use: Rachelle Oyelekou will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan is a carpenter; he builds and fixes furniture when customers ask him.  His wife Pham Thi Gai (pictured) sells porridge and noodle soup at the market.  The family would like a loan in order to buy more ingredients so that they can improve their food stall.  Tan and Gai use the money they earn in order to raise their 4 children, Tham, Thuy, V., and Vu.  All of their children go to school.  When Tan is not busy with his carpentry, he tends to their small plot of land.  They are barely able to earn enough money to feed the family and send their children to school.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for food stall

loans.name: Glenda Amaridis

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Glenda Amaridis, I am a businesswoman, and I have a used clothing store called "El Panpanito," located in the center of my city. I am a single mother and thanks to this business I have helped my children be successful, and with the income that I generate I can cover my family's expenses and other obligations. Today I need to increase my inventory in order to be able to offer my clients a variety of products and I don't have enough capital to do so, therefore I am asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Glenda Amaridis, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, llamdo "EL PANPANITO" el que esta ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, soy madre soltera y gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos, ya que con los ingresos que me genera puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos y no cuento con el capital suficiente, razón por la cual solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase 2 bundles of  American-Classified Clothes

loans.name: Angel Mario

texts.es:
Angel Mario is a man who has struggled greatly for his children's future. He worked for a long as an assistant carpenter in a carpentry shop, but went through jobless times, and so he began to look for work in other places. During some of the time spent without work, he began to think about the possibility of undertaking his own carpentry business, since he was very good at making furniture. And so it was with very little tools and all his savings that he decided to buy wood to make his first furniture. And this is how his business began 14 years ago, one client at a time.

But Angel's struggle still continues, and this is why he's thinking of making furniture to sell to his clients on credit (this way he'd be able to get more of his furniture out there). He is now applying for a loan of $925 USD, which he's willing to pay within 6 months. This loan will make it possible for Angel to purchase raw materials to make furniture to sell on credit.

With your help Angel can move forward with his family and enable his business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel Mario es un hombre que a luchado por sacar s sus tres hijos adelante. Después de haber trabajado mucho tiempo como ayudante de carpintero en una carpintería , se quedó sin trabajo, por lo tanto Ángel empezó a buscar trabajo en oto lugar, sin embargo el tiempo pasaba y no conseguía trabajo, es por eso que comenzó a pensar la posibilidad de emprender su propia carpintería puesto que se le daba muy bien hacer los muebles. Y fue así que con muy poca herramienta y con los últimos ahorros que tenía compró madera para poder fabricar sus primero muebles. Y así fue haciendo poco a poco sus clientes, hoy ya tiene 14 años de haber iniciado esto.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue en pie, y es por esto que está pensando en hacer muebles para poder darlos a crédito y así colocar más muebles entre sus clientes. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ángel podrá comprar materia prima para poder realizar muebles para vender a crédito. Con tu ayuda Ángel podrá sacar adelante a su familia y crecer un poco su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase material of good quality to enhance his product offering. (Comprar materia prima para poder elaborar sus productos)

loans.name: Ward

texts.en: Ward is a 35 years old woman. Ward lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. Ward sells bags and shoes. This is the second time she is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs 400$ to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru:
Safarbek C. is a driver by profession and currently works as a security guard at the “Safariyon” market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has a big family: 5 children, a wife and elderly parents. Previously he drove trolleys and buses, but now that public transport no longer operates and taxis are the main mode of transportation, he has been working as a security guard for 7 years. Safarbek’s job involves guarding the products that are for sale. He gets his salary from the market administration.

Safarbek heard about MicroInvest and decided to ask for a loan to repair his house (this winter his roof leaked and a wall fell over, so he wants to rebuild everything). He has received good recommendations and has good character, which led the credit committee to place his loan on the KIVA site.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Чакалов Сафарбек,по профессии водитель,сейчас работает сторожем на базаре Сафариён,Душанбе,Таджикистан.У него большая семья:5 детей,жена и старые родители.Раньше он водил тролейбусы и автобусы,но сейчас когда обшественные транспорты не работают и преобладают маршрутное такси он работает сторожем уже 7 лет.Его работа заключается в охране товаров.Он получают зарплату у администрации базара.Услышав об Микроинвест он решил обратиться с запросом на потребительский займ на ремонт дома,(так как этой зимой крыша протекла и стена обвалилась,он хочет заново все пересроить ). Получив хорошие рекомендации и добросовестности этого клиента на кредитном комитете он был утвержден на размешении на сайт КИВА.

loans.use: Repairing house.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi N., 40 years old, currently live with her husband at Bac Phuc commune, Soc Son district. Mrs. N. has been in TYM since 1995. All her previous loans had been used to invest in lifestock breeding and dish-washing service (at weddings and funerals). Since 2000, she has moved into a new business, taking wedding pictures, help the bride with make-up and renting wedding dresses. Her income had increased substantially to 300 dollars per month. In addition, Mr. Thiep, her husband has also been working as security guard at the People's Committee. With a more stable flow of income, they have been able to send their two sons to school throughout the years. Both had done very well and are currently at universities in Hanoi, one at Medical School and the other at The College of Economics. She is very grateful for the help from TYM and would like to continue to be part of the group. This loan cycle, she would like to ask for 1200 USD to buy the photograph's screener and new wedding dresses.
