All these qualities allow her to make good business and has succes in it. Now she wants to expand her business and her family will have another source of income with the help of the loan.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Mirna C. has been selling clothing for 20 years in the city of Managua. She is a married mother of three children for whom she is responsible to support.

She began her business with U$200 with the goal of bettering her living conditions as there have been few resources and to support her small children providing them an education so they may grow up to be successful professionals.

Mrs. C. has worked with Ceprodel for 2 years, obtaining 6 loans that have allowed her to better her living conditions and continue to support her three children for today more than ever they need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mirna C. se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con tres hijos de los que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener.

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ha sido de escasos recursos y urge apoyar a sus pequeños brindándole educación para que lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.

La señora C. ha trabajado con Ceprodel desde hace dos años obteniendo 6 créditos que le han servido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y continuar apoyando a sus tres hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn S., 39, is a mother six children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling fish and chickens at a busy market making on average $2.30 each day in profit. Her husband is a taxi-conductor making about $2 per day.

One of her children works driving a motor-taxi, another one is a construction worker, and the rest are enrolled in school.

Due to a growing customer demand, Vorn S. would like to request a loan to expand her inventory to meet her client’s needs. Moreover, because of her children are growing every day, she also needs part of the loan to expand her house.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to meet her client’s needs, and also to expand her house for her growing children.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima" communal bank and lives in Juanjui, in the San Martín region of Peru. She runs her business out her home located in the La Merced neighborhood. She has a convenience store set up selling general groceries and other daily-needed items. With perseverance in her business she was able to send her children to school and turn them into productive members of society. Today she's 71 years old and carries on with the same enthusiasm and is preparing herself for happy golden years.

With the $600 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will invest in the purchase of diverse grocery items such as all kinds of soap, rice, sugar, beans and legumes, toilet paper, fish, canned fruit and oil.

Margarita lives with one of her sons and her daughter-in-law. Her jovial spirit is displayed in the daily attention she pays her customers and she feels happy to be a productive member of society, especially in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal “ Santa Rosa de Lima ” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Libertad en el Barrio La Merced , en la que tiene instalada una bodega donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos de consumo diario. Con su perseverancia en el negocio logró que sus hijos estudiaran y fueran personas útiles a la sociedad. Hoy a sus 71 años continúa con el mismo entusiasmo y preparándose para una vejes feliz. Con el préstamo de S/.1,700.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, será invertido en la compra de diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón por cada marca (marsella, bolivar, jumbo, etc), sacos de 50 kilogramos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades., papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas y aceite por litro, Margarita vive con uno de sus hijos y su nuera. Su espíritu jovial lo demuestra en la atención diaria a sus clientes y se siente feliz de sentirse útil a la sociedad sobre todo a los moradores del sector en el que vive.

loans.use: Purchase groceries like rice, sugar, beans, legumes, etc. / Compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc)

loans.name: Prisciliano

texts.es:
Prisciliano ya tiene un buen dinero ahorrado con el que piensa comprar un terreno, donde futuramente edificara su local de ventas.

Prisciliano C. sells cosmetics. He has been working using credit from the Paraguayan Foundation since 2003. He began as the collector for a cosmetics distributor and little by little he saved to become a seller of cosmetics himself.

Now he has built a large client base and continues to dream of a day when he can guarantee a fixed amount of sales for his business. He visits his clients and this helps him to meet new people that eventually become new clients.

Thanks to the good quality of his products and his friendly demeanor, his clients are satisfied with his products and would like to have a location of his own.

He is always increasing his offerings, thus Prisciliano is seeking a loan to be able to acquire a larger selection of merchandise like body creams, anti-wrinkle aids, makeup, perfume, hair dye, shampoo, salon accessories, brushes etc.

Prisciliano already has money saved with which he can begin to think about buying land to build his store on in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Prisciliano C. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y bajo pedido. Trabaja con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.003. Empezó como cobrador de una empresa distribuidora de cosméticos y poco a poco fue ahorrando para poder dedicarse el mismo a las ventas.

Hoy día tiene una gran clientela formada y sueña con poder contar el día de mañana con un local de ventas fijo. El visita a sus clientes y estos lo ayudan referenciandolo a nuevas personas que luego pasan a ser clientes nuevos.

Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y su amabilidad, sus clientes están bastantes satisfechos con sus productos y lo apoyan para que tenga un local propio.

Como cada vez aumentan más sus pedidos, hoy día, Prisciliano solicita un crédito para poder adquirir un gran lote de mercaderías como cremas para el cuerpo, antiarrugas, maquillajes, perfumes, tintes para cabello, shampoo, accesorios para peluquerías, cepillos, etc.

Prisciliano ya tiene un buen dinero ahorrado con el que piensa comprar un terreno, donde futuramente edificara su local de ventas.

loans.use: To buy goods such as body cream, antiwrinkle creams, makeup, perfume, hair dye, shampoo, accessories for a salon, brushes etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I have been married for four years and have two kids: one boy and one girl. Both of my kids are not of school-going age yet. I reside with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband runs a grocery store; he started the store three years ago. He sells all daily-use items in his shop. He works at the shop from 6 am to 10 pm daily.  We live in a joint family system and therefore we want to save extra profits from our income to build a house of our own.

loans.use: Improve the range of items in our grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a business by adding natural medicines.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim L., 34, lives in Siem Reap Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a taxi-driver. The couple has four young children, one of whom attends school. Lim is now seeking work opportunities for herself and her family. She would like to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike that she and her husband could use to commute to work.

loans.use: Lim would like to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Comité Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
This committee is made up of 17 working women from the Costa Alegre de Cabañas neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. Most of the women make and sell chipas [traditional Paraguayan cheese bread]. The committee is currently in the fifth cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Women Entrepreneurs] program, which provides average loans of about $125 to each of its members.

The committee was established with the first meetings in Maria Cirina S.’s house. Maria took charge of bringing the women together for meetings to appoint members of the group. One of the characteristics of this group is its on-time installment payments and its savings. The committee’s current goal is to meet with other women in the neighborhood to clean the sidewalks and streets, as well as plant trees on the block, all with their children’s care and wellbeing in mind.

Maria is very happy and proud to be an integral part of a group of women with honest goals such as helping to improve the quality of life in their community by doing community work. For example, they have organized athletic activities, musical contests and a San Juan party, with the objective of raising funds to increase their savings. In so doing, the group has planned for any unexpected event that might occur and thus provided the greatest assurance that late payments will not occur.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El comité está compuesto por 17 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Costa Alegre de Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, la gran mayoría son fabricantes y vendedoras de chipas, actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 5 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 494.000 (~$125) para cada integrantes.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Maria Cirina S., quién fue la encargada de convocar a las señoras para las reuniones de conformación del grupo y una de las caracteristica de este comités es la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y sus ahorros. El comité actualmente es tiene como objetivo la de reunirse con las demás señoras del barrio para limpiar las veredas, la calle, arbolarizar la cuadra dónde viven, todo pensando en el cuidado y bienestar de sus hijos.

La señora Maria, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa de ser parte integrante de un grupo de señoras con finalidades nobles como la de ayudar a mejorar el nivel de vida de su comunidad a través de trabajos comunitarios, entre ella destaca que tuvieron que realizar actividades deportivas, concursos musicales y fiesta de San Juan, con el objetivo de recaudar fondos para capitalizar sus ahorros y asi preveer cualquier contingencia que pueda ocurrir en un futuro y por ende evitar al máximo algún tipo de atrasos en sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making traditional Paraguayan bread, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil; as well as merchandise for sale, such as sugar, meat, tea, flour, milk, charcoal and all types of drinks

loans.name: Vahdeta

texts.en:
Vahdeta was born in 1989 and she lives in a suburb of the town of Doboj called Sjenina Rijeka. She has just started working in the textile industry and, in her free time, she sells clothes and cosmetics. 

With this loan of 700 KM, Vahdeta will purchase additional clothes and cosmetics to sell. 

She hopes that she will earn more money, because her husband's salary of 600 KM (~ $420 USD) is not enough for their new life. They are a newly married couple and they need money to start from the beginning.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia inició el negocio por superación personal, ya que le gustan mucho las ventas y para ella es una forma de conocer personas y ayudarlas a través de sus productos naturistas. Comenzó en Agosto de 2004, ella era consumidora de los productos que actualmente vende, pero una amiga que le vendía los productos la convenció para que ella también se convirtiera en vendedora, fue así como comenzó a vender dichos productos, primero entre sus familiares, y después entre vecinos y amistades, los cuales la fueron recomendando con otras personas y en la actualidad tiene un buen numero de clientes. A partir de su crédito anterior otorgado a través de KIVA ha podido incrementar sus clientes aunque este año ha sido un poco difícil por la situación económica.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar más productos que le permita tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
Julia began her business by overcoming personal obstacles, as she likes sales and for her it is a way of getting to know and help people through natural products. She began in August of 2004 as a consumer of the products she sells today. A friend was selling products to her and convinced her that she too should become a seller, and it was this way that she began to sell these products, first to relatives, then to neighbors and friends who were recommended by others and today she has a good number of customers. Beginning with a prior loan given through KIVA she has been able to increase her customers even though it as been a rather difficult economic situation. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 4 months in order to by more jewelry and shoes that will permit her to have a better stock to offer her customers and in this manner increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Georgina Marisela

texts.es: La señora Georgina habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 37  años, se encuentra casada con  el señor Iván Perez que es ingeniero civil, juntos tienen  3  hijos, los cuales están estudiando. La señora Georgina se dedica a la venta de nacatamales que inicio este negocio con las ventas de sopas hace 2 años, ella aspira mejorar su casa donde habita  mas de 9 años, por tanto solicita un crédito de C$  8,000 a un plazo 10 meses para comprar material de construcción y ponerle cielo raso a su casa; así mismo poder en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de estructura de su cocina,  ya que le gustaría ampliarla para invertir mas en la elaboración de nacatamales y de esta forma tener mas ingresos para apoyar mas a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Georgina lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood located in the capital city of Managua. She is 37 years old and is married to Mr. Iván Perez, who is a civil engineer. They have 3 school age children. Ms. Georgina sells nacatamales—Central American tamales—for a living. She started this business via soup sales 2 years ago. She aspires to repair her house of residence, where she has been living for more than 9 years. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $8,000.00 Nicaraguan córdobas, which will be repaid in 10 monthly installments, so that she can build a ceiling for her house. She would also like to improve her kitchen structure in the future because she wants to expand it and invest more in the preparation of nacatamales, thus increasing her income so that she can further support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for ceiling

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile E. is a 36 year old married mother, who lives in the village of Wome. There is no electricity in Wome. It is a small village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.

Cecile makes and sells palm oil to provide for her family. This oil is an ingredient widely used in Togolese dishes. The process of making palm oil takes several days and requires considerable attention and skill. With this loan from Kiva, Cecile plans to buy a fresh supply of palm nuts to make palm oil to sell. With the profits she will earn, she will be able to pay for her childrens’ school fees and other expenses.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of palm nuts, with which to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers in this group, which is made up of people who live in the Kompong Pras Commune in Battambang Province. Mrs. Phong T. is 33 years old. She owns and runs a store in front of her house, where she sells beef soup and roast beef to customers who come to eat in her house. She currently earns approximately $4 per day. She is married to Lot Sitha, age 35, who is a rice farmer who also works with her. They have two children, both of whom are in school. T. hopes to expand her business, which is why she is applying for this loan.

The remainder of borrowers in this loan group are:

Mrs. Lay T., 33, is a teacher who also sells cakes to students. She is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle-repairing materials for her husband's business.

Mrs. Lay T., 28, is a primary-school teacher. Her husband, Som Ol, 40, is buying a car which he will resell at a profit. T. is requesting funds to use as a capital for her husband's business.

Mrs. Pech L., 54, runs a well-digging business and has several employees. She is seeking a loan to buy more well-making materials which will make this work easier.

loans.use: To expand various small businesses

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
La señorita Cecilia Armida H. R. tiene 55 años es secretaria de su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Idiomas en UNT, carrera que ejerció durante 10 años, por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar de trabajar, no tiene hijos.
Cecilia Armida inicio su negocio vendiendo comida rápida por las tardes, con sus ganancias obtenidas logro incrementar su negocio y ahora tiene su propio restaurante, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios de cocina
Con el crédito de 1600 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su restaurante. 
Cecilia Armida sueña con ampliar más su negocio y viajar a EE.
texts.en:
Cecilia Armida H. R. is 55 years old and studies several Languages at the UNT. She used her skills to work for 10 years, but due to a health problem she had to stop working. She has no children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Cecilia started her business selling fast food in the evening. With the money she made, she was able to improve her business, and now she owns a restaurant at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase kitchen supplies. With this $500 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase basic food products for her business. Cecilia’s dream is to diversify her business and to travel to the US.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products for her restaurant

loans.name: Makole F Group

texts.en:
Melania has owned a small food vendor store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 250. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more foodstuffs for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and get more food for her family.

Melania is 45 years old, widowed, and has two children: ages 20 and 18. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Janeth, Lucy, and Dora. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to expand her business

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: C. is 21 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has three children, all of whom are single and under his care. He is married to Saran, 21, who is a firewood provider to their community. C. has been working with his wife since 2002. He uses his cart with oxen for his business and earns a good profit. To make a greater income for the family, C. is requesting a loan of $ 300 to buy one more ox for his business. He dreams of having a bigger house and degrees for his children.

loans.use: To buy one more ox for his business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has managed a rolling store business for almost 3 years. She sells meat and fish in their village. With her desire to increase her products, she wants to borrow PHP 8,000 that she can use to purchase a bigger quantity of fish and meat. Through her business, she is able to help her husband generate income to support the basic needs of their family, for household expenses and to support the education of their children. She strives hard to increase her income for the benefit of their family since her husband does not have a permanent job.

She is already 45 years old and her husband is working as a part-time welder. They have eight children: Analyn – 24 years old, college graduate; Fernando – 21 years old, a helper; Anabelle – 19 years old and already married; Erlindo – 18 years old, a high school sophomore; Ana Rose – 13 years old, grade six; Carla – 10 years old, grade four; Carlo – 8 years old, grade one; Kately Ann – 7 years old, is not studying due to lack of financial resources. They have a big family and she wishes to uplift their poor life situation, thus Ester and her husband are doing their best to become successful in the business.

loans.use: To purchase fish and meat for re-sale

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Greetings from Chantal M. in Kigali, Rwanda! Chantal is 33 years old, married, and has four children (aged 13, 10, 7, and 5 months) and four dependants. 

Chantal is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company, so that she can buy more clothing to sell from her market stall. She has been in business for ten years and has one employee in her shop. She works daily from 7am to 5pm. Chantal is requesting a loan of 500 000 RWF to be repaid on a monthly basis over an eight-month period.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Rodrigo Cristino

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el joven Rodrigo P. se dedica a su negocio de transporte por medio de su triciclo llevando a los clientes de un lugar a otro y cobrando de acuerdo a la distancia recorrida.

El problema que hoy en día el joven P. atraviesa es que el triciclo requiere de reparación y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los repuestos y así continuar con su negocio de transporte.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Rodrigo P. operates a transportation business. On his cycle rickshaw, he brings clients from one place to another, charging according to the distance traveled. The young P.'s present problem is that his cycle needs repair. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel to obtain credit to purchase the replacement parts and continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cycle rickshaw

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Châm Đào Thị (446101154) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two school-aged children. Châm owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, Châm joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Châm is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to expand her business. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her store.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her store

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
E. A. Ernestina is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High. Ernestina sells clothing at Akotokyir. She has been in this business since 2005. Her husband is a security guard. Ernestina uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Ernestina will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale for more profits. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ernestina plans to reinvest for more profits.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.ru: Бобиев Зикрилло проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 25 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Зикрилло более 7 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку, где в основном торгует продуктами питания. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zikrillo B. lives in Kurgan-Tube region. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. Zikrillo has over seven years trading. He has a shop which mostly sells food. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his trade turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of trade turnover

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget S., 30, is a construction builder in the city, with an income of US $4 per day.  His wife stays at home selling boiled sweet potato (a very common tropical plant usually boiled and made into a dessert), with a typical income of US $5 per day. They live with their two school-aged children and they want to improve their business. The current economic condition has made  them struggle lately, and they need more money to save to facilitate their children’s study. So S. has asked for a loan US $200 to purchase more potatoes and fruit to expand his wife’s business. (S.'s wife is in the picture)

loans.use: buying more potatoes and fruits

loans.name: Eno

texts.en: Eno is 42 years old and married with two children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to cook. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Aziza R.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is Aziza S. from Mbozi. She is 31, married and has one 6 year old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphan.
Aziza has been selling used clothing and drinks since 2007. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers such as Aziza, who re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything modern. 
She works 13 - 16 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by one employee and by her husband. Aziza currently earns about 210USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes and drinks in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Aziza thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and drinks in bulk

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette dame est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle est expérimentée dans ce commerce qu’elle exerce depuis 1983. Elle maîtrise bien ce commerce qui lui permet aussi de couvrir les frais scolaires de ses 04 enfants, ce qui lui permet d’apporter une aide financière à son mari. Pour renforcer son stock de produits alimentaires, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 20 plateaux d’œufs, 10 paniers de mangues greffées, 5 paniers de patates douces, un panier d’arachide et d’autres produits nécessaires à son commerce. Elle vend ses produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Hédzranawoè à Lomé.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 28 years old and married with 2 children aged 12 & 8. Florence is a friendly business lady managing a take away in Kirinya village and she agrees that her main challenge was balancing her own books, but now that she associates with her fellow group members, she is able to manage herself businesswise. She prepares chips, fish and chicken for her customers everyday hence being able to make a profit of 40,000/= out of the business. She vies to expand her business so that she could be able to make more money out of it for paying her children’s school fees, food and clothing. Florence makes the chips out of Irish potatoes and she needs a loan to be able to buy Irish potatoes and chicken for her business.

loans.use: Buying irish potatoes and chicken for making chips and chicken.

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen T. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 27 years old and single. Ailen is just starting this business. She is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental.

In 2009, Ailen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ailen is requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: John M.'s Group

texts.en:
This is a cross section of the teachers from the Mathora Secondary School for Girls. The Mathora Secondary school is situated in Magburaka and is one of the oldest secondary schools in northern Sierra Leone. It is a boarding school and currently enrolls 930 pupils. Since its inception in 1959, several of the country’s female dignitaries have passed through this school – ministers, lawyers, doctors, nurses, teachers, police officers and so on. Today, as a result of the new educational system being introduced by the Ministry of Education called the 6334 (i.e. six years in primary school, three years in Junior secondary school, three years in Senior secondary school and four years in university), the school is being divided into a senior and junior secondary schools with two principals running each one of the schools.

In 1998, the rebel invasion of the town of Magburaka left the school in ruins – buildings, staff quarters and dormitories were damaged. Laboratory equipment was destroyed, especially in the home economics and biology departments. Because of the invasion, the students and staff were forced to flee to Freetown to the Richard Allen High School, where they sought refuge until 2003.  After a peace treaty between the rebels and the government was reached in 2002, they were able to return to Magburaka.

With funds from the United Nations and the European Union, the once-mutilated school has been rehabilitated. UNICEF refurnished the laboratories with new equipment. The school is up-and-running once again, but the scar left by the rebels still remains – many of the teachers are not willing to return to the remote village of Mathora and a host of them have decided to remain in Freetown, where living conditions are bit better to that of the Mathora village. There are only a few who are willing to return and are determined to help the pupils of Magburaka and its environs.

Additionally, the teaching profession is one of the least preferred professions in Sierra Leone because salaries are not very attractive. Those who have found themselves in the profession usually are forced to seek other ways of earning more income to supplement their salaries. Many of them either engage in petty trading, in agriculture or in organizing extra classes (a practice the Sierra Leone government is trying to stop) in an effort to make additional money. 

Some of the teachers from Mathora have requested the loan for purposes of expanding their businesses.  Others will use their loans to give to their wives, who may already be businesswomen. It is out of their wives’ businesses that they generate additional income and assist a great deal in the running of their respective households. Furthermore, some of the teachers will be using the loan for either a building project or in buying pieces of furniture – a piece of furniture which they would not normally be able to buy on their current salary. Finally, some will use their loan either to pay school fees and other related charges for their children or pursue further studies themselves.

John M. B. (on the left) is a senior teacher at the school and head of this group. He has been a teacher for eighteen years. John was born in a place call Rotufunk, in southern Sierra Leone. He is forty-eight years old, married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One of their child is attending secondary school and the others are in primary schools. This is the third loan John and others in the group have received from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With his first loan, he was able to pursue a masters degree coarse, with the second loan, he bought a piece of land. And with this loan, Mr. B. will use it to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, iron robs and bags of cements.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like iron robs, corrugated iron zincs and cements

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to for house renovation. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to build a concrete fence at her house. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build a concrete fence at her house

loans.name: Sabina Wanjiku

texts.en:
Sabina Wanjiku is 57 years old and the mother of two children. She is married to John Mkono. Her primary business is dairy farming. She supplies milk in the Uthiru Shopping Center and its area. She also owns rental houses. She has been in the dairy farming business for about 20 years and earns a profit of about 15000 Kenya shillings a month.

Wanjiku has never borrowed from any other financial institution, but this will be her fifth loan from KADET. She was introduced in KADET by the KADET staff. She wants to use her loan to buy another dairy cow so she can provide more milk to meet her client's demands. She hopes to have more cows and supply more milk to dairy cooperative societies. She also hopes to add more rental houses in order to improve her living standard.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for her dairy business

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La socia NERI pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella es madre y padre para sus tres hijos. Los hijos mayores estudian en la Universidad Nacional de San António Abad del Cusco las carreras profesionales de Administración de Empresas y Turismo y el menor estudia en el colegio y tiene nueve años. Los hijos mayores viven en la provincia de Cusco y la socia con el menor viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de secretaria en la UGEL de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para la alimentación, habitación, libros, pasajes, vestimenta y educación de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
NERI, 33, is a member of the "Vilcanota" communal bank. She is a single mother and must be both mother and father to her three sons. The older sons study at the San António Abad del Cusco National University majoring in Business Administration and Tourism, respectively. The youngest son is in school; he is 9 years old. The older sons live in Cusco province and Neri lives with her youngest son in the province of Urubamba, which is north of the city of Cusco. Neri alternates her domestic chores with her work as school secretary at Urubamba's UGEL (Local Peruvian public school). She has been employed here for several years now and does very well thanks to all the effort she puts into work. Neri is a hard-working, enterprising woman that wants to see her children get ahead. She needs financing to pay for her sons' university expenses like room and board, books, transportation costs, clothing, and fees. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room and board, books, travel expenses, clothing and school fees for her sons that are in university.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
SOL  NACIENTE
La socia María Elena es una mujer emprendedora y consciente de que solo trabajando puede salir adelante, hace varios años atravesó momentos difíciles en su vida ya que tuvieron que operarla tras una infección, después de su recuperación tuvo que seguir trabajando para poder mantener a sus pequeños hijos, así que comenzó a preparar desayunos en su casa y venderlos ambulatoriamente, eso solo le alcanza para cubrir parte de los gastos familiares. Así que con el préstamo recibido desea ampliar su negocio, y vender menú para poder obtener alguna ganancia extra, María Elena es la presidente del grupo.
Vilma es otra socia activa que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo hace 2 años, en ese tiempo pudo hacer un buen capital para comprar productos al contado y tener un stock de productos, para la satisfacción de sus clientes, ahora puede ayudar a su esposo con la economía en casa.
Al igual que María Elena, Gladys vende desayuno como ambulante, a veces no tiene muchos compradores, pero ella es optimista y sabe que hay mucha competencia, así que se levanta muy temprano pensando en el futuro de su hijo por el cual se esfuerza diariamente.
Los demás socios tienen diferentes negocios que aunque no les generan muchas ganancias, pueden aportar para algunos gastos, saben que la situación es cada día más difícil pero tienen como objetivo el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
SOL NACIENTE María Elena is an enterprising woman who is aware that it's only through hard work that she can get ahead. Several years ago she went through some difficult times. She needed surgery caused by an infection and, once recovered, had to continue working to be able to support her little children. She began preparing breakfasts at home which she would then go out to peddle. This only produced enough profits to partially cover her household expenses. So, with the funding she plans to enlarge her business preparing not just breakfasts but other meals as well to try to earn additional income. María Elena is the group leader. Vilma is another active member who has sold catalogue beauty products for the past 2 years. In that time, she was able to make enough profits to be able to pay cash for her products and have ample stock available for her customers. Now she is able to help her husband with household expenses. Like María Elena, Gladys peddles breakfasts. Sometimes she doesn't have many buyers but she is optimistic and knows that she has a lot of competition so, she rises very early thinking of her son's future, and makes her best effort each day. The other group members have their various lines of work that, although they don't generate huge earnings, do contribute a bit to cover family expenses. They know that each day the situation becomes more difficult but, still, they have their families' well-being as their objective.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
NUEVA ESPERANZA


La alcancía comunal cursa su tercer ciclo, los trece integrantes son mujeres muy esforzadas y trabajadoras que tratan de progresar a través de sus negocios, muchas de ellas son el sustento económico para su hogar. Así tenemos a Anita y Gladys quienes nos relatan sus experiencias como microempresarias:

Anita tiene 38 años y es madre soltera, desde hace cinco años comenzó hacer trabajos de adornos para el hogar hechos en material de cola de rata, cola de rata satinada, hilo macramé, carteras y sandalias, estos materiales eran fiados al principio porque no contaba con el capital para la inversión. Sus productos lo vendía a sus hermanos, tíos, amigos, vecinos y conocidos. Los préstamos que recibió posteriormente compró pegamentos, hilos de diferentes colores, cola de rata, crochet, asas para bolsos, silicona, suela para sandalias, y accesorios para los trabajos de carteras, adornos para el baño, porta maceteros, esquineros, angelitos y papa Noeles en navidad. Hace un año y medio llevó un curso de platería con la intención de diseñar lindos aretes, sortijas, pulseras y collares y así incrementar sus ingresos. Este último negocio es rentable utilizando las ganancias para pagar la escuela particular a sus hijos, alimentación y gastos del hogar. Posteriormente compró una balanza digital herramienta necesaria para su negocio. El capital que necesita lo invertirá en piedras naturales, hilo de plata en gramos, tenazas, y accesorios para la confección de los trabajos hechos en plata. 

Gladis tiene 57 años, a los 25 años de edad compró unos retazos de tela para confeccionar prendas de bebé, empleó su creatividad para diseñar lindos modelos con el único propósito de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de crianza a sus tres hijos. El deseo de aprender otras cosas la llevó a estudiar cursos de manualidades, chocolatería u otros, allí aprendió a elaborar chocotejas, animalitos de felpa, zapatillas de lona esto lo vendía a sus amigos, vecinos, conocidos y familiares a fin de no faltar la economía en su hogar y educar a su nieto que desde pequeño está al cuidado de ella. El préstamo que recibirá lo utilizará en (manjar blanco, frutas secas, chocolate, envolturas y moldes) para chocotejas, además en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] is on its third loan cycle. The thirteen members are very hard-working women who try to progress through their businesses. Many of them are the source of economic support for their home. We met Anita and Gladis, who told us about their experiences as microbusinesswomen. Anita is 38 and is a single mother. She started to work five years ago making decorations for the home out of materials like ribbon, satin ribbon, and macramé. She also makes wallets and sandals. She bought these materials on credit at the beginning because she didn't have enough capital to invest in them. She sold her products to her siblings, aunts and uncles, friends, neighbors, and acquaintances. She used the loans she received later to buy glue, different colored thread, ribbons, yarn, ties for bags, silicone, soles for sandals, accessories to make wallets, bathroom decorations, flowerpots, corner protectors for furniture, and little angels and Santas for Christmas. She took a silverwork class a year and a half ago with the goal of designing earrings, rings, bracelets, and necklaces to increase her income. Later on she bought a digital scale that she needed for her business. She needs this loan to invest in natural stones, silver thread by the gram, pliers, and accessories to make her pieces out of silver.

Gladis is 57. When she was 25, she bought some fabric remnants to make baby clothes. She used her creativity to make lovely designs with the only goal of supporting her husband with the costs of raising their children. The desire to learn to make other items led her to study courses in crafts, chocolate, and other subjects. This is how she learned to make chocolates, stuffed animals, and canvas shoes that she sold to her friends, neighbors, acquaintances, and family members. She had the goal of supporting her home and educating her grandson that she has been caring for since he was young. She will use this loan to buy dulce de leche, dried fruit, chocolate, wrappers, and molds to make chocolates. She will also buy beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for their businesses making home decorations and chocolates

loans.name: Georgia Group

texts.es:
EL grupo Georgia está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Miriam del Carmen M. A. de 40 años quien desde pequeña trabaja confeccionando ropa pero es hasta1999 que logra tener su propio taller. Ella es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar por los cuales labora arduamente.

M. asegura que su negocio ha mejorado con cada  préstamo que ha tenido, ya que pudo invertir en telas para realizar sus productos. Ella sueña con tener su propia tienda donde vender sus productos.
Sus compañeras son María de los Ángeles M. Vivas quien vende fresco y Pablo Antonio Aguirre que comercializa sandalias.
texts.en:
The Georgia Group is composed of three working people. Miriam del Carmen M. A., 40, has worked at sewing clothing since she was small, but has only had her own workshop since 1999. She is the mother of three children, all in school, for whom she works hard. M.'s business has improved with each loan she has taken, by being able to purchase fabrics needed to create her products. She dreams of having her own shop where she can sell her products. Her group companions are María de los Ángeles M. Vivas, who sells soft drinks, and Pablo Antonio Aguirre who markets sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials such as fabrics, buttons, threads, applique, etc.

loans.name: Musa Barusi

texts.en:
Musa Barusi G. is from Migori town. He is 36 years old, married to Joyce Anzemo, and has four children.
Musa is a farmer and is mainly involved in planting pineapples. His clients are mostly other farmers and he has a stand in the market from which he sells to the local community. He is looking for a loan through Kiva partner, KADET, to enable him to buy more fertilizer. With the profits made from his business, he plans to expand his business to a larger scale, and even diversify to livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Despina

texts.en:
Despina L. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur, married with one school-aged child. She runs a business keeping poultry, both broilers and layers, at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam.  She constructed three poultry cages: one cage is for broilers and two for layers.  Her business income enabled her to construct two poultry cages and meet her family's daily needs.

She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzanian Shillings to extend her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Maria Dolores Z. es nacida en la ciudad de Managua tiene la ead de 37 años, es acompañada, su pareja trabaja como mecanico y le ayuda económicamente de forma eventual a los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 16 y 11 años, los dos estudian actualmente pero la mayor despues de las clases, le ayuda a vender productos de belleza, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos, productos del hogar y loteria, tiene ya mas de 4 años que este ha sido su fuente de ingresos.

Ella comenzo vendiendo estos productos, gracias al apoyo de otros prestamos, ahora ella solicita de un nuevo credito para continuar invirtiendole a su negocio, en la compra de nuevos productos que le permitan aumentar el volumen es sus ventas y una mejor economia que favorezca a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores Z. was born in the city of Managua. She is 37 years old, and has a partner who works as a mechanic. She helps him on a casual basis with the household expenses. She has 2 school-aged children who are 16 and 11 years old. Both of them are currently in school, and the older one also helps her to sell beauty products after school. She is a street vendor who sells beauty products and lottery tickets, and this has been her source of income for over 4 years. She started selling these products thanks to the support of other loans. Now she requests a new loan to continue investing in her business, by purchasing new products that will allow her to increase her sales volume and improve the finances of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a greater inventory for her business

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es: Ramiro de 48 años de edad es soltero, labora para el MINED desde hace 25 años, vive en union libre con la Sra. Elieth Portillo, tiene 5 hijos, 4 ya estan casados y tienen su propia familia, la menor de 17 años se llama Victoria y esta estudiando 3er año de secundaria a quien apoya.  El profesor Ramiro esta solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de construir una habitacion en su casa, para asi tener mayor comodidad y privacidad, ya que la familia es grande y no cuentan con el sufiente espacio para vivir todos, pues en la casa viven los hijos del matrimonio anterior de doña Elieth.  El mayor sueño de Ramiro es poder brindarle a su señora las condiciones basicas de un hogar acorde a sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 48, is single and has worked for the Ministry of Education for the last 25 years. He lives in a common law union with Elieth Portillo; they have 5 children, four of whom are married and have their own families. Their youngest, Victoria, 17, is in 3rd year of secondary school and he supports her. Ramiro is asking AFODENIC for his 5th loan which he will use to build a bedroom in his house in order to be more comfortable and have more privacy since they are a large family and they lack sufficient space for all of them to live because Elieth's children from a former marriage live in the house, too. Ramiro's greatest wish is to provide his wife with basic home conditions according to his means.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en:
Mireille is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of 2 dependent children. After 8 years of experience and a good career, she opened a beauty salon in 2006 and she started receiving her village ladies. During these 3 years, she has been able to make a good number of clients and so, a good business reputation. 

Today, Mireille is requesting to borrow $1,200 to expand her business by adding new services and by purchasing more equipment to increase her business productivity and income as a result of this loan. She will also be able to attract new clients from other areas.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding new services and by purchasing more equipment.

loans.name: Kameme Bakyara Kweterana Group

texts.en:
A determined and very hardworking N. Moses, aged 40 years, is the married father of ten children and two helpless dependents.

Moses has operated a retail shop business for fifteen years, selling general merchandise in Kihihi town. At the end of every month he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 400,000 Ugandan shillings.

Moses’ main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in his business that cannot match the consumption rate of his customers. He is therefore seeking a loan that he figures will help him stock more goods that will satisfy his customers’ high demand and also transform his enterprise into a wholesale business.

Being very committed to the business with good customer care, Moses hopes to increase his sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in his business and enable him to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for his family requirements.

loans.use: To stock more home products in his business

loans.name: Sabougnima Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnima est un groupe de solidarité composé de 07 femmes toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d'âge de 40 ans. Elles résident toutes à NIANFOR, village distant à 90 kilomètres de la capitale régionale (Ziguinchor)elle sont mères d'au moins de 4 enfants.

Leur activité principale est le maraîchage et comme activité secondaire elle font la vente d'huile de palme, de crème glacée et de jus de fruits naturel.

Le groupe de solidarité Sabougnima est l'un des 08 groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de NIAFOR, il est créé en octobre 2002 lors de l'inauguration dudit Banc Villageois. La plus part des membres du groupe de solidarité ont une très bonne expérience du crédit pour en avoir bénéficier à 17 fois et aucun de leur remboursement n'a jamais fait l'objet de difficulté. 

Le prêt actuel leur permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en intrants agricoles et en quantité suffisante en huile de palme et ingrédients pour la fabrique de crème glacée et de jus de fruit naturel.

quant à la présidente du groupe de solidarité, Madame Fatoumata M., numéro 03KD3211081072, elle est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle vend essentiellement de la crème glacée et des jus de fruits fabriqués à base de produits locaux. Et son objectif est d'intensifier son activité en achetant un autre réfrigérateur pour la fabrique de ses produits afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et pouvoir participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.   

En plus du remboursement régulier qu'elles, elles arrivent mensuellement a réaliser une épargne d'environs de 25% de leur crédit.
texts.en:
Sabougnima is a group made up of seven women, all of whom are married and around 40 years old. They all live in Nianfor, a village 90 KM from the capital region of Ziguinchor. They are mothers and have at least four children each. Their primary business is market gardening, but they also sell palm oil, ice-cream, and natural fruit juices. The Sabougnima group is one of eight groups who make up the Village Bank of Niafor. It was created in October of 2002, during the inauguration of the Village Bank project. Most of the members of the group have very good credit, having profited 17 times and never having difficulty in repayment. The current loan has allowed them to stock-up on agricultural fertilizers and a sufficient quantity of palm oil and ingredients for making of ice-cream and fresh fruit juices. As for the president of the group, Mrs. Fatoumata M., number 03KD3211081072, is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She mostly sells ice-cream and fruit juices, made from local ingredients. Her goal is to increase her business by purchasing another refrigerator to make more product in order to earn more profits and be able to improve her family's quality of life. On top of reimbursing their loan regularly, the women earn a monthly savings of about 25% of their funds.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the level of investment in the group

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El comiteEspiritu Santo se formo mediante la invitación de la asesora y el deseo de las señoras de formar un grupo solidari para trabajar y progresar a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida  de sus familias. 
Una de la integrantes es la señora Juana quien se dedica a la venta de Joyas, ellaa sae unicio con esta actividad despues de formar parte del comité, y su forma der trabajo consiste en ofreser sus prendas a  conocido y amigos vendio en ocasiones a crédito o al contado. 
La señora Juana solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas joyas como pulcera, aros, gargantillas, cadenas y otros todosn oro y plata para contar con mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The formation of the “Espirtu Santo” (Holy Spirit) Committee resulted from an invitation offered by an advisor. The women who joined wanted to start a solidarity group so that they could work together and progress toward improving the lives of their families.

One of the members is Sra. Juana who sells jewelry. She started her business after joining the committee. Her work consists of selling accessories to acquaintances and friends. Her sales are made by accepting cash or extending credit. Sra. Juana is requesting a loan to buy more jewelry such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, chains, and other items made of gold and silver so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various articles of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun S., 39, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase raw silk to produce more silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase raw silk to produce more silk products to sell

loans.name: Mbissane

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbissane N. est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis avril 2009. C’est un marié,  père  de 3 enfants en plus de 3 autres personnes dont il assure la charge. Monsieur N. est responsable d’un groupe scolaire de la localité. Compte tenu de l’insuffisance  des revenus qu’il gagne comparés  à ses charges il mène  une activité  d’élevage  en embauche bovine. Pendant les cérémonies  de mariage, de baptême, et autres événements  tels que la Korite, la tabaski ou certaines fêtes  religieuses  la demande est très  forte. A cet effet il sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs qui sera destine a l’achat de bœufs prévus  pour la vente. L’accroissement de ses revenus lui permettra de mieux gérer  ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Mbissane N. is an associate of the Baye Laye branch office since April 2009.  He is married and the father of three children, plus he has three other people to support.  Mr. N. is the head of a school group in town.  Given that he does not earn enough compared to his expenses, he has a business raising and fattening cattle.  During weddings, baptisms, and other events, such as Korite, Tabaski, or certain religious festivals, the demand is quite strong.  To that effect, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs that will be used for buying steers to sell. The growth in his revenues will enable him to manage his family responsibilities better. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a married woman with a boy (four and a half years old) who attends school. Her husband works as an Assurance coordinator and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She has been selling tea leaves from home for the past three years to her neighbors. She also supplies to small scale entrepreneurs.With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase twenty packets of tea leaves. Hilda faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy days, in the months of June and July. She hopes to open another branch in future and to expand her business further. Hilda decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and expand her business. She lives at a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase twenty packets of tea leaves.

loans.name: Mrs. Aun Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen villagers from Thommoda village I. Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Aun P., born I. 1979, is a village bank president who was selected by the other members who will also be using portions of the loan. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice to sell to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Yorn, is a palm-juice collector who sells sugar palm to support his family, and he is also a construction worker. They try to work a lot, but they can only earn a small income. So, to increase her family's income, Mrs. Aun P. is seeking a loan to buy two piglets for breeding and pig food to start a new business, and with the rest of the loan she will purchase fertilizer. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are enrolled I. a local school and are helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssatou D. est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de WALIDANE novembre 2004. Elle a 1 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICROFONANCE.

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 6 bœufs et de l'aliment pour bétail. Elle engraissera les animaux pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssatou D. is 42 years old, married and the mother of 6 dependent children. She has been a member of the WALIDANE Banc Villageois since November 2004. She has had 1 loan from CAURIE-MICROFINANCE. She raises cattle and has operated this business for more than 5 years. She is going to buy six steers and livestock feed with her new loan. She is going to fatten the animals for at least 5 months before selling them in the weekly markets in her area. Her goal is to contribute financially to the improvement of her family’s living conditions and to increase the level of her savings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three pair of steers

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan D. is currently in the business of selling local bread such as mandasi (a doughnut-like pastry), legemat (fried sweet puffs, like doughnut holes) and gelbia Sudanese, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil to sell.  Suzan is 44 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy C. is 39 years old and sells fruit in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about two years and she makes US$ 5 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to increase her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of more stock for resale at his shop

loans.name: Segundo Flavio

texts.es:
Segundo Flavio L. C. tiene 38 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus hermanos en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Segundo es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Segundo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos para sembrar su maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría mejorar su vida. Se desafía por las plagas en sus cultivos. 
Le gusta salir a las fiestas en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Segundo Flavio L. C. is 38 years old. He is single, and he lives with his brothers in the town of Ventanas in the Los Rios Province.

Segundo is a member of the Nueva Esperanze Rural Bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas. It is a farming community dedicated to growing corn, rice, soybeans, beans, and cacao. There are 14 members of the rural bank.

Segundo works growing corn and rice. He applied for the loan for funds to buy the supplies he needs to plant corn and rice. With the support from the loan he will be able to improve his life. His biggest challenge is insect infestation of his crops. 

He enjoys going out to parties in his free time.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to plant corn and rice

loans.name: Zephur

texts.en:
Zephur M. is 59 years old and from the Chavano area. He is married to Mary M. and they have two children: Joyce Ombisa, 20 years old, and Clement Ombima, 18 years old. 

Zephur has a retail shop that he has been running for the past nine years. He is applying for his third loan from Kadet Ltd. and thus, has a good credit history with us. He needs to add sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and bar soaps to his stock. His profits will be used to pay school fees for his children. His business is centrally based in the market and he has a huge clientele.

His desire is to be able to provide the basic needs of his family without struggle and be able to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc., to add to his stock

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Хучаков Муродали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 61 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет с льготным периодом. Целью кредита является посев пшеницы. То есть он хочет закупить семена.
texts.en: Murodali K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 61 years old. He is married and has six children. He has secondary education. He has been in agriculture for more than ten years. He has a plot of land by his home where he sows wheat. He is taking out the loan with a grace period with the purpose of sowing wheat. He wants to buy the seeds of wheat for sowing.

loans.use: To sow wheat

loans.name: Johnny Alfredo

texts.es:
Johnny Alfredo Y. Z. tiene 24 años. Es soltero  vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Johnny se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Johnny Yepez Alfredo Z. is 24. He is single and lives with parents, living in the territory of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He does not have children.

The members of V.R.C. El LA UNION are located in the district of Aguas Frías, belonging to the territory Ventanas.  This counter is committed to farming and short-cycle planting of corn and rice and beans.  This activity takes up a lot of time.

Johnny has devoted his time to farming, especially the planting of corn, rice and beans for three years.  He purchases his products in Ventanas and sells them at the fair in Ventanas and in the same district.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies and fertilizer for crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the changing weather. His dream is to continue working to make money.  He enjoys sports.

loans.use: insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata, de 54 años, vive  junto a su esposo Alejandro de 55 años y sus tres queridos hijos en su casa propia, ella  esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mantener feliz a su familia. Ella vive tranquila laborando en su  chacra, en la cual produce los siguientes productos, como: cacao, café y  plátano. Considera que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que los ingresos que obtiene por sus productos son muy altos  y gracias a ello  puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más terrenos  e incrementar su producción. Honorata viene trabajando en esta actividad hace 30 años y es conocedora  de su labor y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las cosechas, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando frutos, pero considera que lo que menos le agrada son los días de mucha lluvia, porque perjudican su plantaciones. Es su primer crédito con MFP, ella  esta dispuesta  a cancelar puntualmente, porque con el tiempo piensa sacar más financiamiento. Los mil nuevos soles, lo invertirá para contratar operario para que le ayuden a preparar la tierra de su campo agrario antes de la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Honorata is 54 years old.  She lives with her husband, 55 year-old Alejandro, and her three beloved children in her own home.  She is prepared to work very hard to keep her family happy.  She lives a quiet life, working on her farm.  She produces the following crops: cacao, coffee and bananas.  She considers her work to be very profitable since the profits that she makes from her products are very high which has enabled her to get her children ahead and offer them a better future.

Over time, Honorata would like to buy more land and increase her production.  She has been working in this business for 30 years.  She knows her work really well and what she most likes about it are the harvests since she feels that her hard work is paying off.  However, what she most dislikes are really rainy days because the rain threatens her crops.

This is Honorata's first loan with MFP.  She is prepared to make her loan repayments punctually because she is planning to take more loans in the future.  The 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting will be invested in hiring laborers to help her prepare her land before the next sowing season.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help her prepare her land before she sows her crops

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy  vive en Quebrada el Tigre desde hace 12 años trabajando agricultura, también se dedica a la siembra de cítricos como naranja, mandarina en la agricultura siembra maíz, yuca, maní y arroz también se dedica a la ganadería. El señor hace 3 años que trabaja solo con Emprender por que se le dio facilidad de pago, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas y preparado de la tierra para siembra de arroz, es muy trabajador y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Fredy has lived in Quebrada el Tigre for 12 years, working as a farmer.  He grows citrus fruits such as oranges and mandarins; corn, cassava, peanuts and rice.  He also raises livestock.

Fredy has been working with Emprender for 3 years because they offered him credit facilities.  He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds and to prepare his land for sowing rice.  He is a very hard-working man and is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To sow rice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Samuel, and together they have two children, ages six and 11. Her business is in a place called Corner Dagorretti, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town.

She runs a hardware shop where she sells construction materials to the residents of Dagorretti and other neighbouring trading centers. She has been in this business for a period of two years now. 

With this loan, she plans to buy more cement and nails to add to her stock. This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She has paid off her previous loans well and on time.

loans.use: To buy more cement and nails

loans.name: Huamuchapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama huamuchapa, esta ubicado en el municipio D. tecoanapa guerrero, decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama el lugar donD. y ya que todos los integrantes pertenecen a L. misma, L. historia es acerca D. L. señora Silvia C. V., ya que es L. presidenta del grupo elL. tiene 37 años, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, Arturo, areli, KarL. y Alejandro, y los cuatro estudian, dos D. ellos están en quinto y sexto año D. primaria, otro está en tercer año D. preescolar y el más pequeño apenas tiene un año D. edad, elL. tiene una frutería.

Silvia decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que un familiar le comento que era una muy buena fuente D. ingresos, también por que esto le ayudaría para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y L. educación D. sus hijos, al igual que para  mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia, elL. invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. mas mercancía como son: manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, jitomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, zanahoria, pepinos, lechuga y demás frutas y verduras.

ElL. esta muy contenta por que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes, y por lo mismo sus ingresos también han aumentado satisfactoriamente, tanto que hasta se compro una plancha.

L. meta que tiene doña Silvia es L. D. continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas el lugar en donD. tiene su frutería, para tener más surtida su tienda y así tener mas variedad D. productos, y mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen D. hace algún tiempo y son muy responsables con sus pagos, ya que no quieren defraudar L. confianza y apoyo que le están brindando.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios D. kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ha mejorado su calidad D. vida y L. D. su familia al igual que continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno D. los integrantes del grupo huamuchapa.
Celia C. L.-venta d maíz
Aurelia teresa C.-venta D. maíz
Llanet Flórez C.-tienda D. abarrotes
Martimiana C. caciana-venta D. carne
Bulmara R. Ramírez-tienda D. abarrotes
MariceL. A. R.-venta D. pescados
Florencia C. R.-venta D. pollos
Anabel L. C.-vente D. pollos
Silvia C. V.-frutería
María S. G.-frutería
Esperanza D. L. P. L.-tienda D. abarrotes
texts.en:
This group, called Huamuchapa, is located in the town of Tecoanapa, Guerrero.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of the neighborhood where they all live. 

This story is about Silvia C. V. since she is the group's president.  Silvia is 37 years old, married, and has four children: Arturo, Areli, KarL. and Alejandro.  All four are in school.  The first two are in the sixth and fifth year of elementary school, the third is in the third year of pre-school and the youngest is barely a year old.  Silvia owns a fruit store.

Silvia decided to start out in this business because a family member told her that it was a very good source of income.  She also knew that it would help her to support her husband with their household expenses and their children's education expenses and would improve their family's quality of life.  Silvia invested her loan in buying merchandise such as: apples, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce and other fruit and veg.

Silvia is very happy because she says that her business is doing very well.  Both her sales and her number of customers have increased quite a bit.  This means that her profits have also risen satisfactorily, so much so, in fact, that she has even been able to buy an iron.

Silvia's goal is to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can finish complete their higher education and have a better future.  She would also like to grow her small business some more since she would like to expand the premises where she has her fruit store a little.  This will mean that she can better stock her store and thereby sell a wider range of produce and improve her profits.

Silvia tells us that her group works very well since all the members have known each other for some time and they are very responsible in making their repayments since they don't want to let people down after they have placed their trust in them and supported them.
