Mr. Perfecto Socorro R. M. has worked as a security guard for some 14 years. He lives with his partner and 3 other people that he is responsible for. His wife works for the Mercedes "duty-free" zone.

He has a good loan record with CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner), and the loans have been used for his personal use, to buy a home and to better his home with his last loan.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for supporting him and helping him in all of these years to better his standard of living and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better his home.

loans.name: Los Autenticos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Auténticos” están representados por la señora Eva y conformado por 10 miembros los cuales tienen sus negocios establecidos en la misma zona pero con una diversificación D. negocios como la costura D. prendas D. vestir, venta D. comida al paso como empanadas con refresco y tucumanas otras se dedican a la venta D. plantas, abonos, al servicio D. jardinería y al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del mercado comercial existe un alto nivel competitivo, pero lo que marca la diferencia es que las socias del grupo ya tienen clientes fieles y ofertan productos D. buena calidad para no quedar mal con sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición y mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo como llantas nuevas para sus vehículos, retapizados D. asientos y para la adquisición D. mercadería para su venta. En cuanto a la experiencia varios miembros del grupo trabajaron en grupos anteriores y se unieron para seguir trabajando bajo esta modalidad y crecer en sus negocios para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Los Auténticos” (The Authentic Ones) is led by Sra. Eva and consists of 10 members who have established their business in the same area. However, they are engaged in a variety of activities such as sewing garments and selling food to passersby (including empanadas and soft drinks). Others sell plants and compost or proviD. services, such as gardening and public transportation. Within the commercial markets, there is a high level of competition. What makes the difference, however, is that the group members already have loyal customers and offer high quality products so that they do not lose face with them.

This loan will be used to acquire and improve their equipment needed for work, such as new tires for their vehicles and reupholstered seats. They will also purchase merchandise to sell. Regarding their previous credit experience, several members have worked before in solidarity groups. They have joined together to continue working in this manner and growing their businesses in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Kemisa

texts.en: Kemisa is a Nairobi-based businesswoman who runs a salon in the Kibera area. Operating in a good business environment since 1985, Kemisa has carved her own market in Kibera and says that her customers are reliable. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy equipment for her salon. A mother to four teenagers, Kemisa hopes to own land and houses, enlarge the business, employ many and educate children. She describes herself as hardworking, dependable and responsible.

loans.use: Buy equipment for the salon

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred M. is a married man and an entrepreneur. He runs a business buying and selling goats and sheep at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the goats and sheep from the auctions and wholesale suppliers and sells to retail customers for slaughtering as well as to meat suppliers.

Alfred has been in the business for three years and the business income generated helped him to buy a plot of land for house construction and provide business capitalization.

Alfred is requesting a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou G. est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans avec un bébé de 6 mois.  Elle est couturière commerçante depuis 10 ans et  elle est soutenue par son mari dans son activité. 
 En plus des tissus qu’elle vend, elle confectionne des habits destinés également à la vente. Après 2 prêts octroyés par la caisse Jammi Xaleyi de U-IMCEC Thiès qu’elle a réglés sans difficultés avant même la fin de l’échéance, Madame G.  souhaitait un nouveau  prêt de 450 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité. 
Avec cette somme, elle va acheter des tissus thioupes (indigo) venant du  Mali pour les besoins de son business. Elle écoule ses produits le plus souvent à Rufisque dans la région de Dakar et à Mbour une ville située à une centaine de kilomètres de Thiès où elle compte pas mal de clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou G. is married, 40 years old with a six-month-old baby. She has been a professional seamstress for 10 years, and is assisted by her husband in her business. In addition to the fabric she sells, she also tailors clothes for sale. Mrs. G. was granted two loans by the Jammi Xaleyi branch of U-IMCEC in Thiès, and repaid them both without problems and even sooner than scheduled. She is now requesting a new loan of 450,000 FCFA to strengthen her business. This loan will serve to buy ‘thioupe’ pieces of fabric (indigo) from Mali that she needs for her business. She sells her products mainly in Rufisque, in the Dakar region, and also in Mbour, a town located 100 kilometers from Thiès, where she has quite a few customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric for retail business

loans.name: Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta, con sus 60 años es D. apariencia rígida y dura, su historia es conmovedora la dureza que refleja su rostro solo esconD. un gran corazón, ella cuenta que antes no trabajaba por  que su esposo no lo permitía. Tiene 2 hijos  mayores D. 35 y 25 años lamentablemente uno D. ellos dejo el país por motivos D. trabajo y  esto la entristeció mucho a punto D. enfermarse y caer en depresión. Fue una amiga que la anima a vender productos D. belleza y así empieza en este negocio, al principio  por entretenerse en algo, pero hace 2 años empezó con mucha dedicación ya que vio que era muy rentable y sobretodo el echo D. estar ocupada la ayudo a superar en parte la ausencia D. su hijo. 
Una vecina le hablo sobre EDAPROSPO y se animo a formar el grupo “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” todas  amigas del barrio la Sra.Antonieta es la presidenta, es su  carácter la que la ayuda a  llevar su grupo adelante, por otro lado le va muy bien en su negocio y tiene mucha clientela. A pesar del desanimo D. su esposo ella sigue adelante y no se amilana  tiene proyectos que desea cumplir como tener su propia tienda donD. pueda mostrar sus productos D. belleza, con el dinero que D. su actual préstamo comprara  mercadería en productos D. belleza para vender ya  que tiene  pedidos pendientes.
 Antonieta aun tiene sueños por cumplir y sabe que mantenerse ocupada no solo la ayuda a superar la ausencia D. su hijo sino que pueD. ganarse la vida y demostrar que la edad no es un impedimento para seguir trabajando.

*lA Sra. Antonieta es la primera aparece sentada con blusa floreada.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 60, has a hard and rigid appearance. Her story, however, is touching and the harshness of her expression only masks her great heart. She tells us that she didn’t used to work because her husband wouldn’t permit her to. She has two adult children, a 35- and a 25-year-old. Unfortunately, one of them left the country to look for work and this saddened her very much to the point of becoming ill and depressed. A friend of hers motivated her to sell beauty products and this is how she started her business. At the beginning, it was just to have something to do that would keep her mind occupied. However, two years ago she started to really become dedicated to it when she saw how profitable it could be but, above all, being busy helped her to partly overcome her son’s absence. A neighbor in town told her about EDAPROSPO and motivated her to join the “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” (Together We Will Succeed) group. All the members are from the neighborhood and Antonieta is the group president. Her strong character makes it possible for her to lead the group. On the other hand, she does well with her business and she has many customers. Despite her husband’s lack of enthusiasm for her work, she continues ahead and doesn’t become discouraged; she has projects to meet, like having her own store in which to display her beauty products. With the funds from this loan she will buy beauty products merchandise because she has several pending orders to fill. Antonieta still has dreams to fulfill and knows that she must keep busy, not only to overcome her son’s absence, but to earn a livelihood and show that age need not be a barrier to continue working. *Antonieta is seated in front wearing the flowered blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Esperanca Jose

texts.pt:
Esperança José N. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 2 filhos de 29 e 21 anos de idade, já não estudam. Fez somente 3ą classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, porque perdeu o pai muito jovem. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com a mãe depois de perder o pai. Tem um negócio próprio desde a sua juventude, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa, porque não possui conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (fardos de roupa usada para crianças) para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na melhoria da sua casa.
texts.en:
Esperança José was born in the District of Chibuto, in the Gaza Province, South of Mozambique. She is 47 years old, separated and mother of two children who are 29 and 21 years old. They are no longer in school. She only completed 3rd grade and didn't finish school due to the lack of financial resources since her father died when she was very young. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She left Gaza to go to Maputo with her mother after she lost her father. She has had her own business since her youth and does not have any employees. She has an income of around 6.000.00mt, which she spends with household expenses and saves some on her own since she does not have a bank account. She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know about Hluvuku through her sister. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt. She intends to purchase used children's clothing in bulk to increase her inventory. She is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans for improvements in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used children's clothing in bulk

loans.name: Bakirova`s Group

texts.ru:
Токтогул,60, вдова. У нее 5 детей; 4 дочери и 1 сын. Все взрослые и живут отдельно. Клиент занимается животноводством: разведением и откормом скота. До распада СССР она работала в колхозе дояркой. После распада начала заниматься этим делом самостоятельно. Кредит будет потрачен для закупа коров. 

Анаркан 71 лет. Она также как и предыдущий участник группы вдова. Она проживает вместе с внуком. Вместе с внуком она содержит маленькое домашнее хозяйство. Ежемесячная прибыль от животноводства составляет около 45 долларов. Кредит будет использован для закупа овец, которые будут переправлены на пастбище. 

Темиржан, 55, женат. У него 5 детей: сыновьям 32 и 28 лет. Дочерям 27, 25 и 20. Вместе с супругой они разводят скот на протяжении 5 лет. Он тоже планирует закупить скот на полученный кредит. На фотографии также снялась супруга Темиржана.

Майрамкан 54 года. Ее супруг занимается пассажирскими перевозками. У нее 7 детей. На кредит она планирует закупить овец для откорма.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Toktogul is 60 years old, a widow. She has 5 children: 4 daughters and 1 son. All of them are grown and live separately. The client is involved in animal husbandry: breeding and fattening of livestock. Prior to the breakup of the USSR, Toktogul worked as a milkmaid at a collective farm. Then, she started to run this business on her own. The loan will be used to buy cows. Anarkan is 71 years old. Just like the previous group participant, she is a widow. She lives with her grandson. Together, they run a small home business. The monthly income from animal husbandry is about 45 dollars. The loan will be used for the purchase of sheep that will be sent off to a pasture. Temirjan is 55 years, married. He has 5 children: the sons are 32 and 28 years old, and the daughters are 27, 25 and 20. Together with his wife, Temirjan have been breeding livestock for 5 years. He also plans to buy livestock, using this loan. The photograph also shows Temirjan’s wife. Mayramkan is 54 years old. Her husband is involved in passenger transportation. She has 7 children. She plans to use the loan to buy sheep for fattening.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda E. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 30 years old, married, and has two school-age children. To make a living, Belinda is engaged in the agricultural sector, specializing in hog raising. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly income of 3,400 PHP. 

In 2008, Belinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Belinda from PMPC. 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina P. sells provisions in front of her house in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. She has received junior high education. Faustina uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Faustina will use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Faustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou B. est un homme marié de 31 ans et père de 2 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (préfecture de Bougouni,  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt, Monsieur Seydou B. a abandonné l’école pour mener  les activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de bicyclettes.
Il a appris cette activité dès son jeune âge avec son cousin.
Avec une expérience de 8 ans, Monsieur Seydou Bagayogo maitrise parfaitement son activité.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). La vente de ses bicyclettes se fait au marché de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, Monsieur Seydou B. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, afin d’acheter 15 bicyclettes.
Monsieur Seydou B. vend ses bicyclettes au comptant ou à crédit. Il est beaucoup sollicité à la rentrée des classes car chaque enfant veut avoir une bicyclette.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Seydou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de120 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il compte agrandir son entreprise et  assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B. is a 31-year-old married father of two. He lives with his wife and children in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (Bougouni prefecture in Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. B. left school early to go into business, primarily buying and selling bicycles. He learned the business at a young age from his cousin. With 8 years of experience, he has become an expert at his business. He buys his stock in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells his bicycles in the market in Bougouni. His customer base is made up of local residents. To satisfy his customers’ needs, Mr. Seydou B. decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to purchase 15 bicycles. Mr. B. sells his bicycles on a cash or credit basis. He has very high demand at the beginning of the school year, since every child wants a bicycle. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA (West African CFA francs). With this income, he hopes to expand his business and pay his family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycles for resale

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en:
Tiana A. is 57 and married with 8 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Tiana has 1 year of experience in this business.  Tiana needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tiana joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Tiana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase a wheelbarrow, spade, nails, wire fence and galloon for water storage

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: A. Jamshed is 20 years old and is not married. Due to his family’s financial situation, he did not have many opportunities to study at the university. That’s why, after finishing school, he tried to become independent and to find a way of earning in order to help his parents with the family’s expenses. Since 2006, Jamshed has supported his family through his efforts. Through the years, he tried various types of activities and finally, four years ago, he started his business selling cellphones. He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. Currently, his business is doing well, but Jamshed needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Jamshed requests 10,000 Somoni. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones to sell

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Bhagabati T.. She is married and has 10 children, three sons and seven daughters. In 2006, she established her agricultural farming business. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family.

She will use her loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her work. In the future, Bhagabati plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a BPW loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase more seed and fertilizer and to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan was administered by BPW's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Brigite

texts.en: Brigite is married to a farmer. She has five children who are between 6 months and 14 years old. They are all in school, apart from the 6 month old child. She has a small store where she sells household items. She also owns and operates a milling machine to grind grains and vegetables grown locally. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of household items for her store. She eventually hopes to carry a wider variety of goods in her store to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of household items to sell.

loans.name: Mwamini

texts.en:
Mwamini is 44 years old, married with four children.  Mwamini is widely known in the business of selling different styles of clothes.  She has been in this business for about 13 years and her business hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every day.

Mwamini needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Mwamini will expand her business through purchasing more styles of clothes which will mainly include styles for young people because these styles are highly demanded.  With this additional clothing for sale, Mwamini will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: buying different of clothes for sale

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda T. is from the village of Nabannagan, Lasam, Cagayan. She is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Emelda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Emelda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelda is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cruz Del Sur Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Santiago II es un centro focal mediano que acoge a cerca cien asociaciones comunales.  “Cruz del Sur”, es una de ellas, está en su quinto ciclo, de nueve integrantes ocho son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La señora Paulina es la presidenta, la señora Filomena es la secretaria de actas y la señora Bertha es la tesorera de la asociación.  El negocio en el que participa la señora secretaria de actas, es la venta de repuestos de auto, desde hace 3 años.  Ella comenta que fue su esposo quien le enseñó el negocio de vender repuestos de autos.

Su primera solicitud fue de $us 100.-, ahora solicitó Bs. 2000.- en ambos casos, su objetivo era la compra de mercadería. Las ventas son realizadas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio, los jueves y domingo, durante el día.  Le ayuda en el trabajo su esposo.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, la señora comenta que la capacitación.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: transporte, comerciante de libros, venta de comida, venta  de ropa usada, venta de accesorio de autos, llantería y repartidor de leche.
texts.en:
The Santiago II central office is a medium sized office that includes nearly 100 communal associations.  One of those is "Cruz del Sur" (Southern Cross).  It's in its fifth cycle and is made up of nine members; eight women and one gentleman.  Paulina is the president, Filomena is the secretary, and Bertha is the group's treasurer.

The business that Filomena has had for three years is the selling of repair parts for automobiles.  Her first loan was for $100.  She is now requesting 2,000 BS.  In both cases the loan was for the purchase of inventory.  She makes her sales during the day on Thursdays, and Sundays, at the fair in the "16 de Julio" zone.  Her husband helps her.  When asked what she likes best about "Pro Mujes," she tells us that she likes the training.

Other businesses run by the group's members include transportation, book sales, food sales, second hand clothing sales, automobile accessories, tires, and milk delivery.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos de automovil

loans.name: Ntongai

texts.en:
Ntongai is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a hardworking and an ambitious man who runs a retail shop. He mainly sells cereals in his shop. He has been engaged in the business for four years. So far, he has managed to employ two people in his business.  

Ntongai also runs a motorbike transport business for extra income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to start a retail shop. He hopes that someday, he will have three more outlets for his business. He has requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a posho mill to grind maize into corn flour.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill

loans.name: Kirima Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Erisa, age 27, is a married man with three children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi permanent house. He has been in the poultry business for the last five years. He started with three hens which multiplied with time. He wants a loan to buy more chicken layers for his poultry business. He dreams of having a huge farm of chicken layers from which he will sell eggs and be able to educate his children.

Erisa is a member of Kirima Tweimukye Group – each member guarantees the others for accessing a loan.

loans.use: To buy more chicken layers for his poultry business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. makes corn dough and cassava dough at Elmina. She is a widow and has been selling corn and cassava dough for 10 years. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and cassava to make the dough for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a house.
In this picture, Ama has in her hand a sample of corn dough she sells.

loans.use: To buy more maize and cassava to make dough for sale.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. cooks yam and serves it with palava sauce. She also sells cosmetics in Elmina. Vida will use the loan to purchase yams and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to build a house.

Vida is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Vida uses her income to assist her husband in providing her family with their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase yams and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Joyas Para Cristo 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Tania is one of the members of this entrepreneurs group Joyas para Cristo 3 & 4  'Jewels for Christ'.  She is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She sells jewelry, especially silver.   Her plans are to use this loan to invest in bracelets, necklaces, and rings. 

Tania´s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general – many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.  Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a single mom of 2 children, living with her parents.  She said her most difficult challenges are to raise her children and to work on her university career, since it hasn´t been possible to find a job.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Amavi Mawussenam

texts.fr: Amavi est âgée de 23 ans. Elle gère comme activité de revenus, la vente de  bijoux et cumule 6 ans dans  cette activité.  Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et  au Benin à Cotonou et revient vendre au marché d’adawlato. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier Bè. L’objet de ce crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de 10 douzaines de Bracelet, 5 douzaines de boucle d’oreille et 20 boites à bijoux.
texts.en:
Amavi is 23 years old. In order to earn a living, she runs a jewelry business. She has 6 years of experience in this activity. 

She gets her supplies from Accra in Ghana and from Cotonou in Benin and then sells them at the Adawlato market. 

She was born in Lomé and lives in the Bè district. The main purpose of this loan is to purchase 10 dozens of bracelets, 5 dozens of earrings and 20 jewelry boxes.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry

loans.name: Kahunda

texts.en:
Kahunda is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Kahunda faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes hard to sell at an open air market. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour and cooking oil. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cooking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has 7 dependants. Efua sells provisions and stationery on a table at Breman near Elmina. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of the family's bills. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more provisions and stationery for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to re-invest back into the provisions and stationery business.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more provisions and stationery for sale.

loans.name: Gertrudis Francisco

texts.es:
GERTRUDIS FRANCISCO G. TRABAJA COMO VIJILANTE DE SEGURIDAD, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN A CARGO DE EL Y ESWTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
EL HA TRABAJADO TRECE PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA, EL ACUDE NUEVAMENTE A CEPRODEL PARA HACER UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: PERSIANAS, DOS VENTANAS DE MADERA Y VERJAS PARA LAS VENTANAS Y DOS PORTONES DE HIERRO PARA SU CASA DE HABITACION. EL DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL HA PODIDO MEJORAR SU CASITA Y AHORA ESTA MAS SEGURA.
texts.en: Gertrudis Francisco G. works as security guard. He is a family man with three children, all of school age and in his care. He has obtained 13 loans from CEPRODEL to improve his home. This time he is going once more to CEPRODEL to request a new loan for the purchase of building materials such as blinds, two wooden windows, grilles for the windows and two iron gates for his home. He says that thanks to the CEPRODEL loans he has been able to improve his house and that it's much safer now.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store.  Her husband Anthony, who is 33 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 2 to 9 years old. Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements.  Amelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase furniture for her kindergarten

loans.name: Jaime Sr.

texts.en:
Jaime Sr. A. is from the village of Canabuan Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 53 years old. Jaime Sr. is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jaime Sr. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jaime Sr. has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Jaime Sr. joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaime Sr. is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jaime Sr. from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Nterere Ole

texts.en:
Nterere Ole N. is 23 years old and single. He has been farming in his place of abode for the past three years.

He was introduced to KADET by the KADET staff in his dwelling place. He has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and  he has applied for  a third loan, which he has planned to spend to prepare land for farming and purchase fertilizers. 


He intends to use the return from the loan to expand his business. His imaginings are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his future kids to a high level of education.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Patricia Raquel

texts.es:
La Señora. Patricia P. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive por el Sector de Charasol en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es conocida por belleza colonial, cuenta con hermosas iglesias, su gente se dedica al comercio, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Patricia tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión policía, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Patricia tiene una tienda de comestibles y lleva 13 años en este negocio, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, aceites, embutidos y más productos de primera necesidad.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Patricia P. is a member of the Mujeres de la Bahía community bank.  She lives in Charasol neighborhood, in the city of Azogues.  This city is known for its colonial beauty.  It has beautiful churches and its people work in commerce.  They maintain their culture and traditions.
 
Patricia is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 9 and 7 who attend an elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a policeman by profession.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own hom.

Patricia owns a grocery store and has been in this business for 13 years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 10.00pm.

This is Patricia's second loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan in buying products for her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, oils, cold cuts and other essential household products.

Patricia's dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, oils, cold cuts and other essential household products

loans.name: Ma. Lita

texts.en:
Ma. Lita G. is 54 years old and married with three children. 

Ma. Lita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ma. Lita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ma. Lita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Augusta

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 61 años de edad que vive en su casa propia con su esposo, no cuenta  con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, a 40 minutos  del departamento de Piura.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales, agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace varios años María se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos, gallinas y patos) y ganado ovino (ovejas), sus  corrales lo tiene a unos minutos de su domicilio. A sus animales los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo ideal los ofrece en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Piura y de su mismo distrito, lo cual le permite aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo María a solicitado un préstamo  de 600 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animles y ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes,las ganacias le va a permitir poder solventar sus necesidades diarias.  El objetivo de María es que en un futuro su negocio se dedique a la venta al por mayor de animales y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 61-year-old mother who lives with her husband in their own home which does not receive basic services.  They reside in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is 40 minutes away from the Department of Piura.  The residents of this area are known for having businesses that involve selling animals, farming, raising livestock, and making crafts.  

María has been buying and selling poultry (turkeys, chickens, and ducks) and sheep for several years.  Her animal pens are located a few minutes away from her house.  The animals are provided with balanced feed and natural grasses to eat.  When the animals reach the ideal stage of development, she offers them for sale in different markets in the city of Piura and within her own district.  This enables her to increase her earnings so that she can cover her daily household needs.  

María has requested a loan of 600 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy balanced feed for fattening her animals.  This will allow her to offer them at a better price to her customers.  The earnings will help her meet all of her daily needs.  María’s future goal for her business is to become a wholesale seller of animals so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Neyda tiene 29 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos  de 12 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar según la temporada que toca, la socia trabaja en todo lo que puede y es por esta razón que ella según la época vende artículos con relación a las festividades, por ejemplo cuando estamos a vísperas de la navidad la socia invierte su dinero en la compra de mercadería navideña, juguetes, adornos para la época navideña, cuando es la época escolar la socia invierte en la compra de útiles escolares al por mayor para la venta, en la época de fiestas santas ella cambia y compra todo lo relacionado a la época para la venta, en la época de las fiestas del Cusco la socia también invierte su trabajo y compra desde gorritas, sombrillas, para la venta en los desfiles, cuando es época de brujas la socia trae de Lima la capital todo lo referente a disfraces para la época. En esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el dinero en el termino de construcción de su baño, ella desea completar la ducha y los accesorios del baño en su vivienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda (ducha y accesorios).

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Señor de Torrechayoc II" Communal Bank. She lives in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

This borrower, Neyda, is 29 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has one 12 year-old son. Her daily tasks at home vary depending on the season. She works in every way that she can, so she sells different items depending on the time of year and according to the different festivals. For example, around Christmas she invests her money in the purchase of Christmas merchandise, toys, and Christmas decorations. When it is school time, she invests in the wholesale purchase of school supplies to resell. Around the festivals of the saints, she changes things and buys everything related to that season to sell. When it is time for the festivals of Cusco, she also invests in the purchase of hats and parasols to sell at the parades. During the season of witches, she goes to the capital, Lima, and brings back all sorts of costumes for the season.

At this time, Neyda would like to invest this loan in finishing construction of her bathroom. She would like to complete the shower and bathroom accessories in her home. She is requesting this loan to invest in her home (shower and bathroom accessories).

Neyda appreciates and is infinitely grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will allow her to grow in her business and to improve her quality of life. She also promises to comply with the repayment of her loan on time.

loans.use: to finish installing a shower and accessories in her bathroom

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, a resident of Uganda, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

For the past three years, Edith has been operating a business knitting sweaters seven days a week, selling her products from home by means of wholesale and retail. Her main business challenges include defaulters, the ever-increasing price of threads, and transportation costs. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and a motorcycle for hire.

Edith has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more threads and needles. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a knitting school and to recruit young girls to help her with knitting work.

loans.use: to buy more threads and needles for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Karen Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Karen, vive en casa Familiar por la zona Oriental, tiene un hijito de 2 años, la Sra. Raquel tiene un auto que lo da a trabajar como taxi ya lleva 3 años con esta actividad, en el transcurso de estos año logro comprarse un lote y esta construyendo un cuarto, el cual el crédito que se le otorgo fue para terminar  su construcción,  la Sra. llego a la institución por recomendación de una de sus amigas que ya tiene crédito por la rapidez y facilidad que se le otorga dicho crédito, es una persona muy amable y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Karen lives in her family home in the 'zona Oriental' (eastern zone).  She has a 2 year-old son.  Raquel has a car that she provides to other people to use as a taxi.  She has been in this business for three years.  During this time, she managed to buy a plot of land and is building a room.  The loan that she was given was for finishing its construction.  Karen came to our institution through a recommendation from one of her friends who already has a loan and was pleased with the speed and the ease with which she received it.  Karen is a very kind person and she is grateful to our institution for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 46-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
To earn a living, Hue and her husband buy water morning glory, a kind of vegetable, and cut it into small pieces to sell to food stands and markets. They have been engaged in this business for nearly ten years. This business brings in a minimal income to support the family because they have to buy at retail prices. Hue would like to deal with wholesalers who own water morning glory growing ponds so that she could sell her products at lower prices. She would like to take a loan to invest capital for this purpose. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy water morning glory at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a printing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Amy earns additional income from buying and selling purified drinking water. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and the support of loans through NWTF.

Amy is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her printing business. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her printing business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 28 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of his children are currently in school. Godfrey has a small retail shop that sells products such as sugar, which he has had for 3 years.         

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Godfrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godfrey hopes to expand his business. Godfrey is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 42 years old and single. She practices horticultural farming to earn a living.  She has been farming for 10 years.  In addition, she does dairy farming.  She has employed two people to assist her on the farm. She has been able to retain her business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.  She has learned how to save her money. She hopes to have a well-established business in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow, animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a cow, animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tiene un taller de electrónica desde hace dos años, aprendió a través del estudio y hoy día realiza su trabajo para sostener su hogar, repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos como refrigeradoras, cocinas, planchas, horno microondas.
Él nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para el taller, espera con la compra tener lo necesario para finalizar los trabajos pendiente y tener para próximos que puedan llegar.
El taller le ha dado a Jorge mucho, por esta razón el invierte en su mantenimiento, comprando los repuestos necesarios para mejorar el servicio.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his wife and children. He has an electronics repair shop that he has managed for two years. Jorge learned this trade through study and now engages in this line of work to maintain his household. He repairs all types of appliances such as refrigerators, stoves, irons, and microwave ovens.

Jorge is requesting another loan so that he can buy spare parts for his repair shop. He hopes to buy what he needs to complete his outstanding jobs and any other jobs that he has yet to receive. His business has provided much for him, so he wants to invest in order to maintain it by purchasing necessary parts to improve his service.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to restock his repair shop.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42-years-old, married and has three children. He does quarrying so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He has employed two people in his business. He also does farming to supplement his income. 
 
Bernard joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access business loans. He has used his previous loans to improve his business. He has requested  30,000 Kenya shillings to rent land for quarrying.

loans.use: to rent land for quarrying.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 56 years old. She is from the village Brili in the Kartli Region of East Georgia. Mariam is married and lives with her family: her husband Jemal, their 27-year-old son, and her 86-year-old mother-in-law. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business. 

They own dairy farm with 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Mariam's family farm produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of it in the local market. The family also owns 2 pigs and sells on average 20 piglets per year. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Mariam and Jemal grow maize, beans, potatoes and wheat to sell in the local market.  The harvested vegetables are sold locally to greengrocery retailers.  The total average income for the family is 700 Laris (approximately 420 USD) per month, including the pension for Mariam’s mother-in-law. 

Mariam requested credit to pay for cultivating the land and purchasing wheat seeds for sowing.  In the spring, she will harvest the wheat and sell it. The family will get the expected income, which will be used to cover family daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and wheat seeds

loans.name: Halimaan's Group

texts.en: Halimaan is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. She couldn’t provide education to all of them due to poor financial conditions. She is very skillful and makes Pranaday, which is a very popular product among women, used to tie up hair. Her husband makes mud utensils. He has great artful hands and makes beautiful looking utensils which he sells to different shops for profits.  Four of her children also work. They do different kinds of businesses to financially contribute to the family. Halimaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her Pranaday making business. With the loan, she will buy thread and beads in larger quantities to make Paranday of different kinds (simple and beaded). She has been operating her business for many years, and is very confident that an investment will help her improve her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy thread and beads for Paranday making business.

loans.name: Elena Angela

texts.es:
La señora Elena Angela es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y carismática quien es comerciante. Su negocio es bien variado desde venta de pollo hasta ropa…etc. el cual ha sacado adelante poco a poco. Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores de los cuales el mayor es el que le ayuda en el negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio y acondicionar su cuarto poniéndole cielo rasó, cerámica y aire acondicionado.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena Angela is a hardworking, enterprising, and charismatic woman who works as a merchant. Her business involves selling a variety of products that range from chicken to clothing to other items. This business has enabled her to move forward gradually. Elena has three children, all of whom are grown. Her eldest child helps with the business.

She will invest this loan in her business and renovate a room by installing a ceiling, ceramic tiles, and air conditioning.

loans.use: to buy products for her business and to renovate a room.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 29 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in Masindi, Uganda. Five years ago Sarah began buying and selling new clothes. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy clothes to sell.  She hopes to educate her child and expand her business so as to realize maximum profits.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq is a 49-year-old cattle breeder who has 10 years of experience. He breeds cattle and cows for meat and milk purposes. Rafiq is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and one daughter in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Rafiq’s income consists of milk and yogurt sale as well as meat production. He usually buys calves, raises and fattens them, and then sells them for a profitable price in the central livestock bazaar. His brother helps him to run the business. His monthly profit is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) and he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase one milk cow and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia Gregoria; continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos y venta de cereales, la socai vende, maíz en todas las variedades, vende habas, frejol, arvebas, pallares, morayas, trigo, cebada, entre otros productos, la socia tiene su stand aún en el mismo mercado y en la seccion de granos, ella trabja 6 dias a la semana y con este ingreso ella ha terminado de cosntruir su vivienda, y apoyo en los estudios de sus hijos, La socia desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de granos y cerelaes al por mayor para implementar su stand.
texts.en:
The member, Gregoria, continues with her business selling dry beans and grains and cereals.  She sells corn of all varieties, broad beans, beans, peas, butter beans, "morayas" [dehydrated potatoes], wheat, and barley, among other products.

Gregoria still has her stand in the same market in the bean and grain section.  She works six days a week, and with this income she has finished building her house and helped pay for her children's studies.

Gregoria wants the loan to invest in buying grain and cereal wholesale to set up her stand.

loans.use: to buy grain, beans, and cereal wholesale to set up her stand.

loans.name: Gardie

texts.en:
Gardie is 22 and still single. He lives with his parents at Dugayung. He only finished high school and his parents can't afford to send him to college. He wanted to help his parents acquire an income for their needs so he plants and harvests corn to sell. He has been doing farming for three years. 

As of now, he is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow. He hopes this loan will be granted to him. It will be a great help in making his crop more productive and allow him to earn for higher revenue to improve their lives too.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow.

loans.name: Nonvidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIDOKPO est composé de douze personnes qui habitent la même agglomération et mènent toutes des activités. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Eugénie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eugénie est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Fidèle. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Eugénie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Eugénie mène comme activité depuis vingt ans la vente de blé et de sorgho dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Eugénie vend de l’huile végétale. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Eugénie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement NONVIDOKPO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Nonvidokpo group is made up of twelve people who live in the same town and run various businesses. It is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to raising their business volume. The representative of this group, whose name is Eugénie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and married to a welder by the name of Fidèle. The couple has one child who is at school and in their care. The couple also has another child in their care. Eugénie lives with her husband and the children, and the couple covers the various household expenses together. In order to do this, Eugénie has been selling wheat and sorghum in her region for the past twenty years. She sells vegetable oil as a secondary activity. She get her supplies from a town in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover and income, Eugénie is, together with the other members of the Nonvidokpo group, requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sorghum and cans of oil

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Илхом имеет средне - специальное образование, он строитель. На сегодняшний день Илхом занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Ilhom lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He's thirty-six years old, married and has four children. His wife takes care of their household. Ilhom holds a technical degree in construction. He works for hire on various construction projects. Additionally, he grows vegetables for sale. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat seed.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat seed.

loans.name: La

texts.en: La, 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, earning income of US $1 per day. Her husband is employed in a mirror shop, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food US $25, on utility US $5, and other expenses US $40. In order to improve their living standard, La is requesting a loan of US $500 to buy ducks to raise in order to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her poultry farm. Moreover, she wants to build fences around her house and support her children to study to get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase ducks

loans.name: Alma Victoria

texts.es:
Alma es una joven de 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos, ya que son muy deliciosos, también la ciudad de chincha posee playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando Alma tiene un pequeño tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión y en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho empeño Alma trabaja en un supermercado de su ciudad como cajera, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Alma esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como refacción de paredes agrietadas y pintado de vivienda, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.

loans.use: Para refaccion de paredes y pintado.

loans.name: Shahnozakhon

texts.en:
Shahnozakhon is a businesswoman. She was born in 1988 and is living in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a builder.

Shahnozakhon has a business serving wedding parties. She rents out bridal dresses and party decorations. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She wants to have satisfied clients and tries her best. She is planning to buy a new collection of dresses and is asking for the financial support to do so.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of dresses

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a widowed with four children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a food stall in her home area. She has been in this business for several years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda from MCDT-SACCO to buy sweet potatoes,tomatoes,onions,fingers of green banana. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells of retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of buying a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans that are provided by the organization. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes,tomatoes,onions,fingers of green banana.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: To earn a living, Nila and her husband are operating a tricycle known as a “side car” in other region. Tricycle is the common mode of public transportation in the Philippines. They have been doing this business for 12 year to earn a living. Nila and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of their family. Definitely, they are asking for a loan for their tricycle maintenance. They will buy spare parts, motor gear and paint. In this way, they will be able to continue operate their tricycle for their livelihood. The family live in Clarin, Bohol with their children.

loans.use: buy spare parts, motor gear and paint

loans.name: Marina Antonia

texts.en:
My name is Maria Antonia and for over a year I have had a grocery store called Pulperia toñita in the center of my community. I am able to cover my expenses and pay my suppliers. At the moment, I need to supply my store to satisfy customer demand.

Loan Use: Purchase of sugar, butter, rice, beans, pastes, flour, refreshments, candies, churros and others.

Mi Nombre es Maria Antonia, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, operando bajo el nombre de Pulperia toñita, tengo un año de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos y otros comprovisos a proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder satifacer la demanda de cliente.

loans.use: Compra de azucar, manteca, arroz, frijoles, pastas, azucar, harina, desechables, refrescos, confites, churros   y otros.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr. Felix B., father of one child, was born on November 21, 1964, in Akoumapé in Vo prefecture, where he completed secondary school. After having abandoned his studies, he learned welding and works as a welder to this day. He has already borrowed, managed and repaid two consecutive loans.

He is a dynamic individual who wishes to strengthen his business. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of $800 for the purchase of new machines and sheet metal for the manufacture of objects for sale. This will allow him to increase his revenues, which will serve to improve the living conditions of his child as well as his entire family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Père d’un enfant, Monsieur B. Félix est né le 21 novembre 1964 à Akoumapé dans la préfecture de VO, où il a fait ses études jusqu’au cours secondaire. Après avoir abandonné les études, il a appris la soudure. Un métier qu’il exerce jusqu’à ce jour. Il avait obtenu, géré et remboursé deux fois de suite de crédit. Dynamique, il veut renforcer son activité. Pour cette raison, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat de nouvelles machines et des tôles pour la fabrication des objets destinés à la vente. Ainsi, il pourra avoir plus de revenus qui serviront à l’amélioration des conditions de son enfant et de toute la famille

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal and new machinery

loans.name: Maria De Guadalupe

texts.en:
María is married and has 2 sons. Her husband is employed, yet the money he makes is not enough to make ends meet because their children are growing up causing the household expenses to increase. This is why María decided to open a business so she could her husband with the income and give her sons a better quality of life. She started her business in 1995 and little by little it has been improving. By 1998 María already had a middle sized loyal group of clientele, which was very satisfying for her and encouraged her to continue working. María is a hard working woman. ,p> María needs a $750 loan to buy merchandise to provide a greater variety of products, and keep pace with the demand of her clients, which are mainly women. She will repay the loan within 6 to 12 months and she is thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

María está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado y ella al estar creciendo los hijos, sus gastos también, por ello se vio en la necesidad de hacer algo para obtener un ingreso extra al de su esposo y poder brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Empezó con su negocio en 1995 y poco a poco ha ido mejorando y ya para el año 1998 tenía una cartera de clientes fija y de tamaño medio, esto la llena de satisfacción y le da ganas de seguir adelante, María es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y así tener un mejor inventario y poder satisfacer las necesidades y pedidos de sus clientes, que en su mayoría son mujeres. Este préstamo lo pagará en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses y les agradece su apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is a 53-year-old married mother of eight. Her husband works in the fields harvesting corn, while she makes blouses and pants on orders from people near her neighborhood. With the loan, she plans to improve her workplace, purchase fabric and thread, and a better sewing machine that will help produce more garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MANUELA TIENE 53 AÑOS , CASADA, 8 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN EL CULTIVO DEL MAIZ,ELLA TRABAJA COMO MODISTA HACIENDO BLUSAS, PANTALONES A PEDIDO DE LAS PERSONAS QUE VIVEN CERCA DE SU SECTOR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SEMPASUCHIL 1 . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA MEJORAR EL LUGAR DONDE HACE SUS TRABAJOS, COMPRAR TELA E HILOS Y UNA MEJOR MAQUINA QUE LE AYUDE A HACER MAYOR CANTIDAD DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR.

loans.use: Improve her workplace, purchase fabric and thread, and a better sewing machine that will help produce more garments

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: A 35-year-old married mother of 3 school-aged children, Mrs Ung M. lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To help cover her family's expenses, M. works as a tailor, earning on average around $4 each day, while her husband typically generates about $7/day from working as a driver. One of her children is  employed at a garment factory and two of them attend school. This loan is primarily to be used to purchase electrical sewing machines to facilitate her business. Mrs Ung M. is confident that she will be able  to save enough money to open a big tailoring store one day.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical sewing machine to facilitate her business

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men S., age 49, is a housewife with two children who are carpenters. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning about $4 per day. She would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase additional wood and supplies for her children’s carpentry business. By increasing the stock of raw materials, her children can increase output to meet growing customer demand as well as take advantage of bulk discounts on purchasing costs. Her husband is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
I am Shazia B. from Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of three, two boys and one girl. All of my children attend school except the youngest, who is not of school going age yet. I am a textile artist and I embroider clothes on piecework order. My husband runs a small factory where he manufactures beads and sequins. 
I want to expand my embroidery business for which I require a loan of $200.I will buy an embroidery frame and some other related items with this money.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Martha  Del  Carmen

texts.es:
Previously, Señora Martha had a small grocery store in her home, but as her income diminished, she looked for another way to keep working and to help her family economically. She decided to start selling fruits in a market. She has done this activity for six years now, during which she has invested in her location. Along with her husband, she attends to their small business that is the source of economic support for their family.

During the last two and half years, Martha has obtained 12 loans from CEPRODEL, who has been her helping hand in developing her business. They have contributed financial support to the progress of her business, which has let her increase her inventory, improve the infrastructure of her location, and contribute day after day to the economic support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Anteriormente la Señora Martha se dedicaba a atender una pequeña pulpería en su casa , pero al disminuir sus ingresos busca la forma de seguir trabajando para ayudar económicamente a su familia y decide trasladarse a vender frutas en el mercado, en esta actividad ya tiene 6 años durante los cuales ha invertido en su local y en conjunto con su esposo atienden su pequeño negocio que es la base económica del sustento de su familia.

Durante los últimos dos años y medio ha obtenido doce prestamos con CEPRODEL que ha sido su mano amiga en desarrollo de su negocio, al contribuir con su aporte financiero en el progreso de su negocio al permitirle el incremento de su inventario, mejoras en la infraestructura de su local, y así día a día se gana su sustento y el de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Telnaz

texts.en:
Telnaz is a very active woman and has good entrepreneurial skills. She is 47 years old and has been running her cattle breeding business for 18 years now. She is married and has 4 children. The whole family helps her with the business. Her eldest son is in the picture. Telnaz lives in the Soltanabad village in the Saatli region in Azerbaijan.

Recently, Telnaz realised that she can make more money if she acquires more livestock. So she decided to buy new calves, and has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $700 USD.

loans.use: to buy more calves to earn more money

loans.name: Delfa

texts.es:
Delfa is the mother of 4 children and has been able to provide security and well being for them by means of her handmade crafts. Her husband is dedicated to the production of handmade goods and together they desire to increase the variety of their goods. In order to do so they are asking for your help by means of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Delfa es madre de cuatro hijos y con su labor artesanal ha podido brindarles seguridad y bienestar. En compañía de su esposo se dedica ala fabricación de artículos artesanales y el deseo de incrementar sus productos, la conducen a solicitar tu ayuda a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to increase the variety of goods offered.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very energetic and hard-working entrepreneur and the proud mother of a unique four-year-old daughter. She is also the leader of a group of five women who carry on various businesses in the community. Elizabeth has been selling tennis equipment and shoes for more than three years in the Libertador community of Santo Domingo, and since moving into a small store, she has been able to increase her customer base significantly. With her loan, Elizabeth is hoping to introduce a new line of fashionable tennis equipment in order to attract new people to her business.

Elizabeth’s group members are: Rosa J. B., who plans to expand a beauty products store; Ercilia Del Carmen G. P., who will buy more shoes for her business; Amantina Nieve S., who will acquire women’s clothing for her small business, and Jenny C. J., who will purchase silver jewelry to resell in her community.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and tennis equipment for a small business.

loans.name: Celina's Busara Group

texts.en:
Celina is 39 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 16 and 10 years old. Celina sells charcoal and vegetables. She started in 2000. Every day, she works from 12am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and vegetables. She will share this loan with her subgroup members MwaJ., Asha, Rahma, and Shani, who have businesses in charcoal sales, clothing sales, tailoring, a butchershop, and chicken sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and vegetables for her business.
